Description: Vertically integrated eastward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass\_weighted\_vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by dry static\_energy per mass unit)

Name: sw17O
Title: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-17 in Sea Water
Description: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-17 (17O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water

Name: yvelbase
Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

Name: mrsoLut
Title: Total Soil Moisture
Description: "Water" means water in all phases. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including "content\_of\_soil\_layer" are used.

Name: aerasymbnd
Title: Aerosol Level Asymmetry Parameter for Each Band
Description: The asymmetry factor is the angular integral of the aerosol scattering phase function weighted by the cosine of the angle with the incident radiation flux. The asymmetry coefficient is here an integral over all wavelength bands.

Name: ocontemppmdiff
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Name: emibbso2
Title: total emission rate of SO2 from all biomass burning
Justification for inclusion: To quantify emissions from all burning sources

Name: cldnvi
Title: Column Integrated Cloud Droplet Number
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  Values are weighted by liquid cloud fraction in each layer when vertically integrating, and for monthly means the samples are weighted by total liquid cloud fraction (as seen from TOA).

Name: cRoot
Title: Carbon Mass in Roots
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in roots, including fine and coarse roots.

Name: emich4
Title: Total emission rate of CH4
Justification for inclusion: To calculate methane budget with new methane emissions-driven modelling capability

Name: wetso4
Title: Wet Deposition Rate of SO4
Description: Deposition rate of sulfate aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

Name: acabf
Title: Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: Specific mass balance means the net rate at which ice is added per unit area at the land ice surface. Computed as the total surface mass balance on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell. A negative value means loss of ice

Name: chldiat
Title: Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: Chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Name: intppmisc
Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

Name: cly
Title: Total Inorganic Chlorine Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Cly = HCl + ClONO2 + HOCl + ClO + Cl + 2\*Cl2O2 +2Cl2 + OClO + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic stratospheric chlorine (e.g., HCl, ClO) resulting from degradation of chlorine-containing source gases (CFCs, HCFCs, VSLS), and natural inorganic chlorine sources (e.g., sea salt and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

Name: abs550no3
Title: Ambient nitrate aerosol absorption optical thickness at 550nm
Justification for inclusion: To unravel reason for model spread in direct aerosol effect

Name: nMineralNH4
Title: Mineral Ammonium in the Soil
Description: SUM of ammonium over all soil layers

Name: emiss
Title: Total Emission Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: mmraerh2o
Title: Aerosol Water Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction is used in the construction mass\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y. It means the ratio of the mass of X to the mass of Y (including X). "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient\_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

Name: od550aerh2o
Title: Aerosol Water Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: proposed name: atmosphere\_optical\_thickness\_due\_to\_water\_ambient\_aerosol

Name: utendvtem
Title: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Northward Advection and Coriolis Term
Description: Tendency of zonally averaged eastward wind, by the residual northward wind advection (on the native model grid). Reference: Andrews et al (1987): Middle Atmospheric Dynamics. Academic Press.
Comments: incorrect units

Name: cLitterBelow
Title: Carbon Mass in Below-Ground Litter
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Name: hur700
Title: Relative humidity at 700 hPa
Justification for inclusion: Relative humidity at 700 hPa on high frequencies is useful for looking at the dynamical control on clouds.

Name: phycpico
Title: carbon concentration of picophytoplankton
Justification for inclusion: Requested by Fish-MIP as part of ISIMIP. Needed for model intercomparisons for marine biodiversity and ecosystems.

Name: yvelsurf
Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "y" indicates a vector component along the grid y-axis, positive with increasing y. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.'

Name: smc
Title: Shallow Convective Mass Flux
Description: The net mass flux represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.  For models with a distinct shallow convection scheme, this is calculated as convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

Name: tauvcorr
Title: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress Correction
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

Name: reffsclwtop
Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Stratiform Cloud
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over liquid stratiform cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Name: fFireAll
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Including All Sources [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: From all sources,  Including natural, anthropogenic and Land-use change. Only total fire emissions can be compared to observations.

Name: tauvo
Title: Sea Water Surface Downward Y Stress
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

Name: dissi13c
Title: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-13 Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon-13 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: fg13co2
Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-13 as 13CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of carbon-13 as CO2 (positive into ocean)

Name: fNOx
Title: Total Land NOx Flux
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. "Nox" means a combination of two radical species containing nitrogen and oxygen NO+NO2. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Name: pon
Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations

Name: siforcecorioly
Title: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
Description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

Name: reffsnowc
Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Snowfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Name: zvelbase
Title: Upward Component of Land-Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). "basal" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Name: dissi13cos
Title: Surface Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-13 Concentration
Description: Near surface dissolved inorganic carbon-13 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: cLitter
Title: Carbon Mass in Litter Pool
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Name: ygwdparam
Title: Northward Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Parameterised y- component of gravity wave drag

Name: clic
Title: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Ice
Description: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: c14Land
Title: Mass of 14C in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in vegetation (any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass), litter (dead plant material in or above the soil), soil, and forestry and agricultural products (e.g. paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock).

Name: mmrpm10
Title: PM10 Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 10 micrometers

Name: exppob
Title: Downward sinking flux of particulate organic phosphorus at seafloor
Justification for inclusion: Understanding the sinking flux of particulate organic phosphorus reaching the ocean bottom will help understand and constrain nutrient fluxes in the sediments.

Name: nLitterSurf
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Above-Ground Litter (non CWD)
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Surface litter" means the part of the litter resting above the soil surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Name: ponos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic nitrogen component concentrations

Name: limfediaz
Title: Iron Limitation of Diazotrophs
Description: In ocean modelling, diazotrophs are phytoplankton of the phylum cyanobacteria distinct from other phytoplankton groups in their ability to fix nitrogen gas in addition to nitrate and ammonium. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: o2os
Title: Surface Dissolved Oxygen Concentration
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'.

Name: conccn
Title: Aerosol Number Concentration
Description: "Number concentration" means the number of particles or other specified objects per unit volume. "Aerosol" means the system of suspended liquid or solid particles in air (except cloud droplets) and their carrier gas, the air itself. "Ambient\_aerosol" means that the aerosol is measured or modelled at the ambient state of pressure, temperature and relative humidity that exists in its immediate environment. "Ambient aerosol particles" are aerosol particles that have taken up ambient water through hygroscopic growth. The extent of hygroscopic growth depends on the relative humidity and the composition of the particles.

Name: od550so4so
Title: Stratospheric Optical Depth at 550nm (Sulphate Only) 2D-Field (Stratosphere Only)
Description: Stratospheric aerosol AOD due to sulfate aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: difvmo
Title: Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to momentum.

Name: thetaot
Title: Vertically Averaged Sea Water Potential Temperature
Description: Vertical average of the sea water potential temperature through the whole ocean depth

Name: omldamax
Title: Mean Daily Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Mixing Scheme
Description: The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by the mixing scheme is a diagnostic of ocean models. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.

Name: fgsf6
Title: Surface Downward SF6 Flux
Description: gas exchange flux of SF6

Name: fLulccAtmLut
Title: Carbon Transferred Directly to Atmosphere Due to any Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Activities [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon directly to the atmosphere due to any land-use or land-cover change activities.  Include carbon transferred due to deforestation or agricultural directly into atmosphere, and  emissions form anthropogenic pools into atmosphere

Name: expsiob
Title: Downward sinking flux of particulate silicon at seafloor
Justification for inclusion: Understanding the sinking flux of particulate organic silicon reaching the ocean bottom will help understand and constrain micronutrient fluxes in the sediments.

Name: emibboa
Title: total emission of organic aerosol from all biomass burning
Justification for inclusion: To understand sources of organic aerosol in models

Name: pbfe
Title: Biogenic Iron Production
Description: 'Mole concentration' means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as 'nitrogen' or a phrase such as 'nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen'. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Name: o3
Title: Mole Fraction of O3
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: o3prod
Title: O3 Production Rate
Description: ONLY provide the sum of all the HO2/RO2 + NO reactions (as k\*[HO2]\*[NO])

Name: fsfe
Title: Surface Downward Net Flux of Iron
Description: Iron supply through deposition flux onto sea surface, runoff, coasts, sediments, etc

Name: hcho
Title: Formaldehyde Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: therssl
Title: regional sterodynamic sea level

Name: vsfriver
Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: zero for models using real water fluxes.

Name: chlos
Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations at the sea surface.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of 'Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration' plus 'Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration'

Name: zoocos
Title: Surface Zooplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of zooplankton carbon component concentrations

Name: utendogw
Title: Eastward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the eastward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.

Name: sootsn
Title: Snow Soot Content
Description: the entire land portion of the grid cell is considered, with snow soot content set to 0.0 in regions free of snow.

Name: basin
Title: Region Selection Index
Description: A variable with the standard name of region contains strings which indicate geographical regions. These strings must be chosen from the standard region list.

Name: acabfIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: Specific mass balance means the net rate at which ice is added per unit area at the land ice surface. Computed as the total surface mass balance on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell. A negative value means loss of ice

Name: ta850
Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air temperature at 850hPa

Name: intpbfe
Title: Iron Production
Description: Vertically integrated biogenic iron production

Name: difvmbo
Title: Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity Due to Background
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to momentum due to the background (i.e. caused by a time invariant imposed field which may be either constant over the globe or spatially varying, depending on the ocean model used).

Name: wdir
Title: Total Waves Direction
Justification for inclusion: inclusion of the wave model's output

Name: qgwr
Title: Groundwater Recharge from Soil Layer
Description: Mass flux of water from the soil layer into ground water.

Name: clwmodis
Title: MODIS Liquid Cloud Percentage
Description: Mass of cloud liquid water, as seen by the  Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: fVegLitterMortality
Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Mortality
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Name: clt
Title: Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: opottemprmadvect
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Description: The phrase "residual mean advection" refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.

Name: noaahi2mmax
Title: max 2m daily NOAA heat index
Justification for inclusion: Important to estimate the heat stress impact on human health
Atmosphere review comments copy: Can this use the existing CF Standard Name heat_index_of_air_temperature? I think this is the same quantity, but have not found direct confirmation.

Name: nudgincsm
Title: Nudging Increment of Water in Soil Moisture
Description: A nudging increment refers to an amount added to parts of a model system. The phrase "nudging\_increment\_in\_X" refers to an increment in quantity X over a time period which should be defined in the bounds of the time coordinate. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Water" means water in all phases. The mass content of water in soil refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including "content\_of\_soil\_layer" are used.

Name: vas
Title: Northward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Northward component of the near surface wind

Name: simassacrossline
Title: Sea Ice Mass Area Flux Through Straits
Description: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
Comments: Typo in title of simassacrossline

Name: rldcs
Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Name: fNVegLitter
Title: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass.

Name: rsutcsaf
Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Flux corresponding to rsutcs resulting from aerosol-free call to radiation, following Ghan (ACP, 2013)

Name: hfss
Title: Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Name: hfssLut
Title: Sensible Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Description: Upward sensible heat flux on land use tiles. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Name: phynos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Phytoplankton Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations

Name: h2o
Title: Mass Fraction of Water
Description: includes all phases of water

Name: dispkexyfo
Title: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to XY Friction
Description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from lateral frictional dissipation associated with Laplacian and/or biharmonic viscosity. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.

Name: dissi14cabio
Title: Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: bsios
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate silica component concentrations

Name: emibbch4
Title: total emission of CH4 from all biomass burning
Justification for inclusion: To understand sources of methane with new methane emissions-driven model capability

Name: popos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic phosphorus component concentrations

Name: mmrbc
Title: Elemental Carbon Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of black carbon aerosol particles in air.

Name: grassFracC3
Title: C3 Natural Grass Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 natural grass.

Name: co3satcalc
Title: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Name: wetlandFrac
Title: Wetland Percentage Cover
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by wetland. Report only one year if  fixed percentage is used, or time series if values are determined dynamically.

Name: rlusIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: uaUTLSadd
Title: 6 hourly instantaneous northward wind at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)
Justification for inclusion: Requested to study impacts on aviation. Needed to diagnose clear air turbulence.

Name: ts
Title: Surface Temperature
Description: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Name: nh4
Title: Dissolved Ammonium Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: opottemppadvect
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection). Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Name: rhc13
Title: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Name: mlotstmin
Title: Minimum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

Name: chlmisc
Title: Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: Chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone

Name: chlcalcos
Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the calcite-producing phytoplankton component alone

Name: sci
Title: Fraction of Time Shallow Convection Occurs
Description: Fraction of time that shallow convection occurs in the grid cell.

Name: fLitterSoil
Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into soil from litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Name: tendlibmassbf
Title: Total Basal Mass Balance Flux
Description: The total basal mass balance flux over land ice is a spatial integration of the basal mass balance flux

Name: zhalf
Title: Altitude of Model Half-Levels
Description: Height of model half-levels above a reference ellipsoid. A reference ellipsoid is a mathematical figure that approximates the geoid. The geoid is a surface of constant geopotential with which mean sea level would coincide if the ocean were at rest. The ellipsoid is an approximation because the geoid is an irregular shape. A number of reference ellipsoids are defined for use in the field of geodesy. To specify which reference ellipsoid is being used, a grid\_mapping variable should be attached to the data variable as described in Chapter 5.6 of the CF Convention.

Name: dems
Title: Stratiform Cloud Emissivity
Description: This is the in-cloud emissivity obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

Name: epfz
Title: Upward Component of the Eliassen-Palm Flux
Description: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics Meridional component Fz of the Eliassen-Palm (EP) flux (Fy, Fz) derived from 6hr or higher frequency fields (use daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr are not available). Please use the definitions given by equation 3.5.3b of Andrews, Holton and Leovy text book, but scaled by density to have units m3 s-2.

Name: phycdiat
Title: carbon concentration of diatoms
Justification for inclusion: Requested by Fish-MIP as part of ISIMIP. Needed for model intercomparisons for marine biodiversity and ecosystems.

Name: rsds
Title: Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations.

Name: rsdscs
Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance clear sky for UV calculations

Name: emilnox
Title: Layer-Integrated Lightning Production of NOx
Description: Integrate the NOx production for lightning over model layer. proposed name: tendency\_of\_atmosphere\_mass\_content\_of\_nox\_from\_lightning

Name: od550csaer
Title: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: AOD from the ambient aerosols in clear skies if od550aer is for all-sky (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550nm"

Name: fDeforestToAtmos
Title: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Atmosphere as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Name: phydiazos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Name: sfo3max
Title: Daily Maximum O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: sandfrac
Title: Sand Fraction
Description: "Volume fraction" is used in the construction volume\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: tasmin
Title: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: min")

Name: libmassbffl
Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: Specific mass balance means the net rate at which ice is added per unit area at the land ice base.  A negative value means loss of ice. Computed as the total basal mass balance on the floating land ice (floating ice shelf) portion of the grid cell divided by floating land ice (floating ice shelf) area in the grid cell. Cell\_methods: area: mean where floating\_ice\_shelf

Name: treeFracBdlEvg
Title: Broadleaf Evergreen Tree Area Percentage
Description: This is the percentage of the entire grid cell that is covered by broadleaf evergreen trees.

Name: tntrl
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of air temperature due to longwave radiative heating

Name: rsucsafbnd
Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation in Bands
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds (following Ghan). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Name: tatp
Title: Tropopause Air Temperature
Description: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

Name: swtoaasdust
Title: All-Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Dust at Toa
Description: Instantaneous forcing is the radiative flux change caused instantaneously by an imposed change in radiative forcing agent (greenhouse gases, aerosol, solar radiation, etc.).

Name: sialb
Title: Albedo of sea-ice covered surface
Justification for inclusion: Surface albedo is a GCOS variable for which comparison is useful. It cannot be retrieved with currently available monthly fields on the sea ice grid.

Name: sos
Title: Sea Surface Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Name: fg14co2abio
Title: Surface Downward Mass Flux of Carbon-14 as Abiotic 14CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Gas exchange flux of abiotic 14CO2 (positive into ocean)

Name: sisnthick
Title: Snow Thickness
Description: Actual thickness of snow (snow volume divided by snow-covered area)

Name: sitempsnic
Title: Temperature at Snow-Ice Interface
Description: Report surface temperature of ice where snow thickness is zero

Name: clis
Title: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Description: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud ice  in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: dryh2
Title: dry deposition rate of H2
Justification for inclusion: To understand the budget of molecular hydrogen

Name: seawdir
Title: Sea Wave Direction
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of the Wave model's output

Name: sidmassmeltlat
Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Lateral Melting
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through lateral melting divided by grid-cell area (report 0 if not explicitly calculated thermodynamically)
Comments: Change name and title for consistency with other sea ice mass change terms

Name: sistressmax
Title: Maximum Shear Stress in Sea Ice
Description: Maximum shear stress in sea ice (second stress invariant)
Comments: Inconsistency in names of sea ice stress terms

Name: tsns
Title: Snow Surface Temperature
Description: Temperature of the snow surface as it interacts with the atmosphere, averaged over a grid cell.

Name: xvelmean
Title: X-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity
Description: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice

Name: dissi14c
Title: Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: intpp
Title: Primary Organic Carbon Production by All Types of Phytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton.  This should equal the sum of intpdiat+intpphymisc, but those individual components may be unavailable in some models.

Name: zfull
Title: Altitude of Model Full-Levels
Description: Height of full model levels above a reference ellipsoid. A reference ellipsoid is a mathematical figure that approximates the geoid. The geoid is a surface of constant geopotential with which mean sea level would coincide if the ocean were at rest. The ellipsoid is an approximation because the geoid is an irregular shape. A number of reference ellipsoids are defined for use in the field of geodesy. To specify which reference ellipsoid is being used, a grid\_mapping variable should be attached to the data variable as described in Chapter 5.6 of the CF Convention.

Name: rhVgt
Title: Heterotrophic Respiration on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Justification for inclusion: This physical parameter allows to assess phenology simulated by models and the relative impact for future projections at vegetation type level.

Name: mrtws
Title: Terrestrial Water Storage
Description: Mass of water in all phases and in all components including soil, canopy, vegetation, ice sheets, rivers and ground water.

Name: clwc
Title: Mass Fraction of Convective Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Calculated as the mass of convective cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: sfpm10
Title: PM10 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer
Justification for inclusion: For quantifying air quality and health impacts

Name: siflsensupbot
Title: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux Under Sea Ice
Description: the net sensible heat flux under sea ice from the ocean

Name: phydiat
Title: Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Name: tendacabf
Title: Total Surface Mass Balance Flux
Description: The total surface mass balance flux over land ice is a spatial integration of the surface mass balance flux

Name: vegHeight
Title: Height of the Vegetation Canopy
Description: Vegetation height averaged over all vegetation types and over the vegetated fraction of a grid cell.

Name: treeFracSecEver
Title: Percentage Cover by Secondary Evergreen Trees
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary evergreen trees.

Name: ccn02
Title: CCN concentration at 0.2 percent supersaturation, based on aerosol chemical composition and size
Justification for inclusion: Addresses current gaps in ACI, nitrate aerosol budget, and climate responses

Name: sivols
Title: Sea-Ice Volume South
Description: total volume of sea ice in the Southern hemisphere

Name: thetaot700
Title: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 700m
Description: Upper 700m, 2D field

Name: siconc
Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage (Ocean Grid)
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by sea ice

Name: mrso5
Title: Mean soil water content at a depth of 5 cm
Justification for inclusion: Based on the recent scientific need to consider soil moisture at different layers, I'd like to propose standard names for soil moisture at the depths of 5cm, 10cm, 20cm, 50cm, and 100cm. The naming of these physical parameters follows the existing "mrso", whose CF Standard Name is _mass\_content\_of\_water\_in\_soil_. The number of corresponding depths has been added to the end of the term.

Name: esn
Title: Snow Evaporation
Description: Water here means water in all phases. Evaporation is the conversion of liquid or solid into vapor. (The conversion of solid alone into vapor is called "sublimation".) In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. Unless indicated in the cell\_methods attribute, a quantity is assumed to apply to the whole area of each horizontal grid box. Previously, the qualifier where\_type was used to specify that the quantity applies only to the part of the grid box of the named type.  Names containing the where\_type qualifier are deprecated and newly created data should use the cell\_methods attribute to indicate the horizontal area to which the quantity applies.

Name: sidconcdyn
Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Dynamics
Description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through dynamics-related processes (advection, divergence...)

Name: prsnc
Title: Convective Snowfall Flux
Description: convective precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.

Name: md
Title: Wet Diameter Mode Coarse Insoluble
Description: Emission from a primary source located anywhere within the atmosphere, including at the lower boundary (i.e. the surface of the earth).

Name: cct
Title: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Top
Description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud top altitude should be that of the top of the highest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Name: expnob
Title: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Nitrogen Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Justification for inclusion: Understanding the sinking flux of particulate organic nitrogen reaching the ocean bottom will help understand and constrain nutrient fluxes in the sediments.

Name: mmrpm2p5
Title: PM2.5 Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction atmospheric particulate compounds with an aerodynamic diameter of less than or equal to 2.5 micrometers

Name: areacella
Title: Grid-Cell Area for Atmospheric Grid Variables
Description: For atmospheres with more than 1 mesh (e.g., staggered grids), report areas that apply to surface vertical fluxes of energy.

Name: cSoilMedium
Title: Carbon Mass in Medium Soil Pool
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in medium (rate) soil pool. Medium means a lifetime of more than than 10 years and less than 100 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

Name: calc
Title: Calcite Concentration
Description: Sum of particulate calcite component concentrations (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Name: tau
Title: Momentum Flux
Description: module of the momentum lost by the atmosphere to the surface.

Name: sbl
Title: Surface Snow and Ice Sublimation Flux
Description: The snow and ice sublimation flux is the loss of snow and ice mass per unit area from the surface resulting from their direct conversion to water vapor that enters the atmosphere.

Name: dfe
Title: Dissolved Iron Concentration
Description: Dissolved iron in sea water,  including both Fe2+ and Fe3+ ions (but not particulate detrital iron)

Name: o3ref
Title: Reference ozone mole fraction used in diagnostic call to radiation scheme
Justification for inclusion: Part of package of diagnostics for diagnosing instantaneous radiative forcing by ozone

Name: pastureFracC3
Title: C3 Pasture Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 pasture

Name: fbddtdic
Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon

Name: v2
Title: Mean-Squared Northward Wind Speed
Description: v\*v

Name: dissicnatos
Title: Surface Natural Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration at preindustrial atmospheric xCO2

Name: grassFrac
Title: Natural Grass Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell that is covered by natural grass.

Name: sidivvel
Title: Divergence of the Sea-Ice Velocity Field
Description: Divergence of sea-ice velocity field (first shear strain invariant)

Name: n2o
Title: Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.   The chemical formula of  nitrous oxide is N2O.

Name: aod550volso4
Title: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Stratospheric Volcanic Aerosols
Description: Aerosol optical depth at 550nm due to stratospheric volcanic aerosols

Name: reffrains
Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Rainfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Name: abs550oa
Title: Ambient Particulate Organic Matter Aerosol Absorption Optical Thickness at 550nm
Justification for inclusion: To unravel reason for model spread in direct aerosol effect

Name: sf6
Title: Mole Concentration of SF6 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of sulfur hexafluoride is SF6.

Name: wetnoy
Title: Wet Deposition Rate of NOy Including Aerosol Nitrate
Description: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species, out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3 aerosol, NO3 (radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates.

Name: netAtmosLandCO2Flux
Title: Net Flux of CO2 Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Name: lwsrfasdust
Title: All-Sky Surface Longwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Description: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover.

Name: rhTree
Title: Heterotrophic Respiration on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total RH of trees in the grid cell

Name: jo2
Title: Photolysis Rate of Diatomic Molecular Oxygen
Description: Rate of photolysis of molecular oxygen to atomic oxygen (o2 -> o1d+o)

Name: evspsbl
Title: Evaporation Including Sublimation and Transpiration
Description: Evaporation at surface (also known as evapotranspiration): flux of water into the atmosphere due to conversion of both liquid and solid phases to vapor (from underlying surface and vegetation)

Name: snw
Title: Surface Snow Amount
Description: The mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; reported as missing where the land fraction is 0; excludes snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.

Name: fgcfc11
Title: Surface Downward CFC11 Flux
Description: gas exchange flux of CFC11

Name: clwvi
Title: Condensed Water Path
Description: Mass of condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Comments: Precipating hydrometeors

Name: hfdsl
Title: Downward Heat Flux at Land Surface
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Downward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed downward (negative upward). The vertical heat flux in air is the sum of all heat fluxes i.e. radiative, latent and sensible. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: mlotstmax
Title: Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Description: Sigma T is potential density referenced to ocean surface.

Name: no3
Title: Dissolved Nitrate Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: hfbasinpadv
Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized eddy-induced advective transport due to any subgrid advective process. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Name: albs
Title: Planetary albedo
Justification for inclusion: Provision of band-mean planetary albedo

Name: fDeforestToProduct
Title: Deforested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use Change
Description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Name: nppWood
Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Wood as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by wood due to NPP

Name: phydiaz
Title: Mole Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Name: c3h6
Title: C3H6 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: limirrcalc
Title: Irradiance Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: Growth limitation of calcareous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: rhSoil
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Soil on Land
Description: Needed to calculate soil bulk turnover time

Name: zg
Title: Geopotential Height
Description: Geopotential is the sum of the specific gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the specific centripetal potential energy. Geopotential height is the geopotential divided by the standard acceleration due to gravity. It is numerically similar to the altitude (or geometric height) and not to the quantity with standard name height, which is relative to the surface.

Name: mrsol
Title: Total Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in all phases, including ice.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Name: limndiat
Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Diatoms
Description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: sfpm1
Title: PM1.0 mass mixing ratio in lowest model layer
Justification for inclusion: To quantify air quality and health impacts

Name: intpbn
Title: Nitrogen Production
Description: Vertically integrated biogenic nitrogen production

Name: litemptop
Title: Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Description: Upper boundary temperature that is used to force ice sheet models. It is the temperature at the base of the snowpack models, and does not vary with seasons. Report surface temperature of ice sheet where snow thickness is zero

Name: bddtdip
Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Phosphorus Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved phosphate

Name: pr17O
Title: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid and liquid phases.

Name: ci
Title: Fraction of Time Convection Occurs in Cell
Description: Fraction of time that convection occurs in the grid cell.

Name: swellwpp
Title: Swell waves peak period
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of wave model's output

Name: sidmasstrany
Title: Y-Component of Sea-Ice Mass Transport
Description: Includes transport of both sea ice and snow by advection

Name: rlut4co2
Title: TOA Outgoing Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Name: limirrdiat
Title: Irradiance Limitation of Diatoms
Description: Growth limitation of diatoms due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: tropoz
Title: Tropospheric Ozone Column
Description: Tropospheric ozone column, should be consistent with definition of tropopause used to calculate the pressure of the tropopause (ptp). Calculated at 0 degrees C and 1 bar, such that 1m = 1e5 DU.

Name: siflswutop
Title: Upwelling Shortwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: The upwelling shortwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

Name: wap2
Title: Mean-Squared Vertical Velocity (Omega)
Description: omega\*omega

Name: sftlf
Title: Percentage of the Grid Cell Occupied by Land (Including Lakes)
Description: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by land.

Name: fHarvestToProduct
Title: Harvested Biomass That Goes into Product Pool
Description: be it food or wood harvest, any carbon that is subsequently stored is reported here

Name: prw2H
Title: Mass of Water Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O) in Layer
Description: Water vapor path for water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O)

Name: sftof
Title: Sea Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of horizontal area occupied by ocean.

Name: isop
Title: Isoprene Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction of isoprene in air.

Name: albdirbnd
Title: Direct Surface Albedo for Each Band
Description: The fraction of the surface direct downwelling shortwave radiation flux which is reflected. It is equivalent to the surface bidirectional reflectance at the incident angle of the incoming solar radiation and integrated over all outgoing angles in the hemisphere above the surface.  Reported in spectral frequency bands.

Name: hursmax
Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Relative Humidity
Description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Name: expcalc
Title: Downward Flux of Calcite
Description: Downward flux of Calcite

Name: slthick
Title: Thickness of Soil Layers
Description: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid cell.

Name: cLand
Title: Total Carbon in All Terrestrial Carbon Pools
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: mlotstsq
Title: Square of Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness Defined by Sigma T
Description: The phrase "square\_of\_X" means X\*X. The ocean mixed layer is the upper part of the ocean, regarded as being well-mixed. The base of the mixed layer defined by "temperature", "sigma", "sigma\_theta", "sigma\_t" or vertical diffusivity is the level at which the quantity indicated differs from its surface value by a certain amount. A coordinate variable or scalar coordinate variable with standard name sea\_water\_sigma\_t\_difference can be used to specify the sigma\_t criterion that determines the layer thickness. Sigma-t of sea water is the density of water at atmospheric pressure (i.e. the surface) having the same temperature and salinity, minus 1000 kg m-3. "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer.

Name: rsus
Title: Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: mrrob
Title: Subsurface Runoff
Description: Runoff is the liquid water which drains from land. If not specified, "runoff" refers to the sum of surface runoff and subsurface drainage. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: vegHeightCrop
Title: Height of Crops
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the crop fraction of a grid cell.

Name: hfsifrazil
Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Frazil Ice Formation
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase. "Frazil" consists of needle like crystals of ice, typically between three and four millimeters in diameter, which form as sea water begins to freeze. Salt is expelled during the freezing process and frazil ice consists of nearly pure fresh water.

Name: sidconcth
Title: Sea-Ice Area Percentage Tendency Due to Thermodynamics
Description: Total change in sea-ice area fraction through thermodynamic processes

Name: cSoilGrass
Title: Carbon Mass in Soil on Grass Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content\_of\_soil\_layer are used.

Name: vmo
Title: Ocean Mass Y Transport
Description: Y-ward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.

Name: sidmassmeltbot
Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Bottom Melting
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass through melting at the ice bottom divided by grid-cell area

Name: lwsrfcsdust
Title: Clear-Sky Surface Longwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Description: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculating in clear-sky conditions.

Name: rMaint
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Maintenance Autotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Maintenance respiration is defined as the carbon cost to support the metabolic activity of existing live tissue.

Name: shrubFrac
Title: Percentage Cover by Shrub
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by shrub.

Name: fsn
Title: Surface Downward Net Flux of Nitrogen
Description: Flux of nitrogen into the ocean due to deposition (sum of dry and wet deposition), fixation (the production of ammonia from nitrogen gas by diazotrophs) and runoff (liquid water which drains from land).

Name: sisi
Title: Dissolved Silicon Amount in Sea Ice
Justification for inclusion: Some CMIP7 models now have sea ice biogeochemistry included and are interested in saving these variables. Models that include sea-ice biogeochemistry support closing the carbon and nutrient s' cycles in the sea-ice zone.

Name: limfecalc
Title: Iron Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: treeFracSecDec
Title: Percentage Cover by Secondary Deciduous Trees
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by secondary deciduous trees.

Name: tasLut
Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature on Land Use Tile
Description: Air temperature is the bulk temperature of the air, not the surface (skin) temperature.

Name: rsdsIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface solar irradiance for UV calculations

Name: raShrub
Title: Autotrophic Respiration on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total RA of shrubs in the grid cell

Name: opottemptend
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from all processes. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Name: vaUTLSadd
Title: 6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind at 2 additional pressure levels in the UTLS region (175 and 225 hPa)
Justification for inclusion: Requested to study impacts on aviation. Needed to diagnose clear air turbulence.

Name: sidmasssi
Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Description: The rate of change of sea ice mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Name: dryso2
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of SO2
Description: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

Name: strbasemag
Title: Land Ice Basal Drag
Description: Magnitude of basal drag at land ice base

Name: drivw
Title: Change in River Storage
Description: Change over time of the mass of water per unit area in the fluvial system (stream and floodplain).

Name: sisndmassdyn
Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Advection by Sea-Ice Dynamics
Description: The rate of change of snow mass through advection with sea ice divided by sea-ice area
Comments: "Change names of snow-on-sea-ice terms to start with ""sisn"""

Name: parag
Title: Aragonite Production
Description: Production rate of Aragonite, a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of aragonite is CaCO3.

Name: rhc14
Title: Carbon-14 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Heterotrophic respiration is respiration by heterotrophs ("consumers"), which are organisms (including animals and decomposers) that consume other organisms or dead organic material, rather than synthesising organic material from inorganic precursors using energy from the environment (especially sunlight) as autotrophs ("producers") do. Heterotrophic respiration goes on within both the soil and litter pools.

Name: dpco2
Title: Delta CO2 Partial Pressure
Description: Difference in partial pressure of carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.

Name: c3PftFrac
Title: Percentage Cover by C3 Plant Functional Type
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C3 PFTs (including grass, crops, and trees).

Name: snicefreezIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Description: Mass flux of surface meltwater which refreezes within the snowpack. Computed as the total refreezing on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Name: dyvo
Title: Northward gridbox width on v points
Proposer name: Jenny Mecking – Ocean and Sea Ice Author Team – National Oceanography Centre – Climate and Uncertainty group
Justification for inclusion: To be able to do accurate calculations for the ocean model the width of the gridboxes in both the east/west and north/south direction is essential. This is particularly true if ocean transects are being investigated. Furthermore, attempting to estimate these parameters using the longitudes and latitudes from the t,u and v grid points often leads to incorrect values due to some models artificially narrowing channels (e.g. Strait of Gibraltar and between various islands in the Indonesian Through flow region.

Name: u2
Title: Mean-Squared Eastward Wind Speed
Description: u\*u

Name: ocfriver
Title: Flux of Organic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
Description: Organic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

Name: siforceintstry
Title: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (Y-Component)
Description: Y-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

Name: sfcWind
Title: Near-Surface Wind Speed
Description: near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

Name: phyfe
Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton iron component concentrations

Name: agesno
Title: Mean Age of Snow
Description: Age of Snow (when computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.  Reported as missing data in regions free of snow on land.

Name: emiavnox
Title: emission rate of nox from aviation
Justification for inclusion: To understand sources of nitrogen in models

Name: nOther
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stem and Root
Description: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.

Name: drynh3
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of NH3
Description: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

Name: do3chm
Title: Net chemical production of O3
Justification for inclusion: To better understand ozone budgets, due to o3prod and o3loss (P-L) not fully capturing the net chemical tendency of ozone

Name: wethno3
Title: Wet deposition of HNO3
Justification for inclusion: To calculate nitrogen budgets

Name: rsdcs
Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Downwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)

Name: ocontemprmadvect
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Residual Mean Advection
Description: Conservative Temperature is defined as part of the Thermodynamic Equation of Seawater 2010 (TEOS-10) which was adopted in 2010 by the International Oceanographic Commission (IOC). The phrase "residual mean advection" refers to the sum of the model's resolved advective transport plus any parameterized advective transport. Parameterized advective transport includes processes such as parameterized mesoscale and submesoscale transport, as well as any other advectively parameterized transport. When the parameterized advective transport is represented in the model as a skew-diffusion rather than an advection, then the parameterized skew diffusion should be included in this diagnostic, since the convergence of skew-fluxes are identical (in the continuous formulation) to the convergence of advective fluxes.

Name: tntrs
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of air temperature due to shortwave radiative heating

Name: cOther
Title: Carbon Mass in Vegetation Components Other than Leaves, Stems and Roots
Description: E.g. fruits, seeds, etc.

Name: detocos
Title: Surface Detrital Organic Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of detrital organic carbon component concentrations

Name: nRoot
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Roots
Description: including fine and coarse roots.

Name: od550aer
Title: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: AOD from the ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 550nm"

Name: fbddtdin
Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Nitrogen Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of nitrogen nutrients (e.g. NO3+NH4)

Name: emibbnh3
Title: total emission rate of NH3 from all biomass burning
Justification for inclusion: To understand sources of NH3 and nitrate aerosols

Name: tob
Title: Sea Water Potential Temperature at Sea Floor
Description: Potential temperature at the ocean bottom-most grid cell.

Name: hfdsnb
Title: Downward Heat Flux at Snow Base
Description: Heat flux from snow into the ice or land under the snow.

Name: chlmiscos
Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Other Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll from additional phytoplankton component concentrations alone

Name: co3satarag
Title: Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Name: wmo
Title: Upward Ocean Mass Transport
Description: Upward mass transport from resolved and parameterized advective transport.

Name: sistrxubot
Title: X-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Description: X-component of ocean stress on sea ice

Name: epcalc1000
Title: Downward Flux of Calcite at 1000m
Justification for inclusion: Better representation of the carbonate pump with the improved ability over fluxes at 100m (<https://bg.copernicus.org/articles/20/1195/2023/>)

Name: siflsenstop
Title: Net Upward Sensible Heat Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the net sensible heat flux over sea ice

Name: nVeg
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Vegetation
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: tsnIs
Title: Ice Sheet Snow Internal Temperature
Description: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as missing in regions free of snow on land.

Name: npp
Title: Net Primary Production on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: "Production of carbon" means the production of biomass expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. Net primary production is the excess of gross primary production (rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors) by autotrophs ("producers"), for example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton, over the rate at which the autotrophs themselves respire some of this biomass. "Productivity" means production per unit area. The phrase "expressed\_as" is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A.

Name: po4
Title: Total Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic phosphorus" means the sum of all inorganic phosphorus in solution (including phosphate, hydrogen phosphate, dihydrogen phosphate, and phosphoric acid).

Name: dpco2nat
Title: Natural Delta CO2 Partial Pressure
Description: Difference in partial pressure of natural-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

Name: vtendogw
Title: Northward Acceleration Due to Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized orographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)

Name: osaltpsmadvect
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection.

Name: friver
Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Rivers
Description: computed as the river flux of water into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Name: nbp
Title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Biospheric Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the net mass flux of carbon from atmosphere into land, calculated as photosynthesis MINUS the sum of  plant and soil respiration, carbon fluxes from fire, harvest, grazing  and land use change. Positive flux is into the land.

Name: tnt
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature

Name: volo
Title: Sea Water Volume
Description: Total volume of liquid sea water.

Name: swellswh
Title: Swell Significant Wave Height
Justification for inclusion: inclusion of the wave model's output

Name: prCrop
Title: Precipitation over Crop Tile
Description: includes both liquid and solid phases

Name: tnhusscpbl
Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Stratiform Cloud and Precipitation and Boundary Layer Mixing  (to be specified only in  models which do not separate budget terms for stratiform cloud, precipitation and boundary layer schemes.  Includes all boundary layer terms including and diffusive terms.)

Name: msftmz
Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Name: zg10
Title: Geopotential Height at 10hPa
Description: Geopotential height on the 10hPa surface

Name: raOther
Title: Total Respiration from Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with Ra\_root

Name: mrsosLut
Title: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column of Land-Use Tile
Description: the mass of water in all phases in a thin surface layer; integrate over uppermost 10cm

Name: cnc
Title: Canopy Covered Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of area covered by vegetation.

Name: pflw
Title: Liquid Water Content of Permafrost Layer
Description: \*where land over land\*, i.e., this is the total mass of liquid water contained within the permafrost layer within the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

Name: cSoilPools
Title: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Pool (Summed over Vertical Levels)
Description: For models with multiple soil carbon pools, report each pool here. If models also have vertical discretisation these should be aggregated

Name: reffclwtop
Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius as seen from space over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell. This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere (TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Name: seaswh
Title: Sera Significant Wave Height
Justification for inclusion: inclusion of the wave model's output

Name: residualFrac
Title: Percentage of Grid Cell That Is Land but neither Vegetation Covered nor Bare Soil
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is land and is covered by  neither vegetation nor bare-soil (e.g., urban, ice, lakes, etc.)

Name: no3os
Title: Surface Dissolved Nitrate Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: ocontemppsmadvect
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Conservative Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized submesoscale eddy advection. Reported only for models that use conservative temperature as prognostic field.

Name: od443dust
Title: Optical Thickness at 443nm Dust
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 443 nanometres.

Name: intpbsi
Title: Silicon Production
Description: Vertically integrated biogenic silica production

Name: pnitrate
Title: Primary Carbon Production by Phytoplankton Due to Nitrate Uptake Alone
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton due to nitrate uptake alone

Name: tnhuspbl
Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.

Name: toz
Title: Total Column Ozone
Description: Total ozone column calculated at 0 degrees C and 1 bar, such that 1m = 1e5 DU.

Name: depthsl
Title: depth of soil across all soil layers
