Justification for inclusion: different models treat soils differently, with the number of soil layers, and their thickness, varying. To get the information about the total thickness of soils in a model this variable is proposed.

Name: cSoilLut
Title: Carbon in Soil Pool on Land-Use Tiles
Description: end of year values (not annual mean)

Name: vegHeightGrass
Title: Height of Grass
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the grass fraction of a grid cell.

Name: tosga
Title: Global Average Sea Surface Temperature
Description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.

Name: mrros
Title: Surface Runoff
Description: The total surface run off leaving the land portion of the grid cell (excluding drainage through the base of the soil model).

Name: irrLut
Title: Irrigation Flux Including any Irrigation for Crops, Trees, Pasture, or Urban Lawns
Description: Mass flux of water due to irrigation.

Name: expcob
Title: Sinking Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Justification for inclusion: The sinking flux of particulate organic carbon reaching the ocean bottom is an essential quantity determining the function and fluxes of the sediments.

Name: conccmcn
Title: Number Concentration Coarse Mode Aerosol
Description: includes all particles with diameter larger than 1 micron

Name: t2
Title: Mean-Squared Air Temperature
Description: Air temperature squared

Name: epcalc100
Title: Downward Flux of Calcite
Description: The phrase 'expressed\_as' is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Standard names also exist for aragonite, another polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Name: hfbasinpmadv
Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Name: swsrfcsdust
Title: Clear-Sky Surface Shortwave Radiative Flux Due to Dust
Description: The direct radiative effect refers to the instantaneous radiative impact on the Earth's energy balance, excluding secondary effects such as changes in cloud cover. Calculated in clear-sky conditions.

Name: tsn
Title: Snow Internal Temperature
Description: This temperature is averaged over all the snow in the grid cell that rests on land or land ice.  When computing the time-mean here, the time samples, weighted by the mass of snow on the land portion of the grid cell, are accumulated and then divided by the sum of the weights.   Reported as missing in regions free of snow on land.

Name: h2loss
Title: Loss of H2 due to chemical destruction
Justification for inclusion: To understand hydrogen budget

Name: swtoafluxaerocs
Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: Downwelling shortwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call

Name: rsutcsbnd
Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Name: litempbotfl
Title: Basal Temperature of Floating Ice Shelf
Description: Basal temperature that is used to force the ice sheet models, it is the temperature AT ice shelf-ocean interface.  Cell\_methods: area: mean where floating\_ice\_shelf

Name: rsutcs
Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of clouds.

Name: chepsoa
Title: Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Secondary Organic Matter
Description: If model lumps secondary organic aerosol (SOA) emissions with primary organic aerosol (POA), then the sum of POA and SOA emissions is reported as OA emissions. Here, mass refers to the mass of primary organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.

Name: sifllwdtop
Title: Downwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the downwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always positive)

Name: dmsos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Dimethyl Sulphide in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration of dimethyl sulphide in water in the near surface layer

Name: thetaoga
Title: Global Average Sea Water Potential Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field

Name: fracInLut
Title: Annual Gross Percentage That Was Transferred into This Tile from Other Land-Use Tiles
Description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as a percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Name: rsdoabsorb
Title: Net Rate of Absorption of Shortwave Energy in Ocean Layer
Description: "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. "Layer" means any layer with upper and lower boundaries that have constant values in some vertical coordinate. There must be a vertical coordinate variable indicating the extent of the layer(s). If the layers are model layers, the vertical coordinate can be model\_level\_number, but it is recommended to specify a physical coordinate (in a scalar or auxiliary coordinate variable) as well. Net absorbed radiation is the difference between absorbed and emitted radiation.

Name: ppdiat
Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom component alone

Name: prw17O
Title: Mass of Water Vapor Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O) in Layer
Description: Water vapor path for water molecules that contain oxygen-17 (H2 17O)

Name: tr
Title: Surface Radiative Temperature
Description: Effective radiative surface temperature, averaged over the grid cell

Name: clivi
Title: Ice Water Path
Description: mass of ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). Includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeor affects the calculation of radiative transfer in model.
Comments: Precipating hydrometeors

Name: aeroptbnd
Title: Aerosol Level Absorption Optical Thickness for Each Band
Description: Optical thickness of atmospheric aerosols in wavelength bands.

Name: rlucs4co2
Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Name: lon
Title: Longitude
Description: Longitude is positive eastward; its units of degree\_east (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_longitude should be used instead of longitude. Grid longitude is positive in the grid-eastward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

Name: hfsnthermds
Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Snow Thermodynamics
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "Snow thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

Name: nLitterSubSurf
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Below-Ground Litter (non CWD)
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Subsurface litter" means the part of the litter mixed within the soil below the surface. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Name: ch4global
Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4
Description: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CH4

Name: limirrmisc
Title: Irradiance Limitation of Other Phytoplankton
Description: Growth limitation of miscellaneous phytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: rsd4co2
Title: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Downwelling shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Name: aragos
Title: Surface Aragonite Concentration
Description: sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Name: seampw
Title: Sea Waves Mean Period
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of the Wave model's output

Name: tntrlcs
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Clear Sky Longwave Radiative Heating

Name: c14Litter
Title: Mass of 14C in Litter Pool
Description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Name: rlutcso3ref
Title: Top of atmosphere outgoing longwave radiative flux under clear-sky conditions from diagnostic call to radiation scheme with a reference ozone field
Justification for inclusion: When used in combination with output from the prognostic call to the radiation scheme, it can be used to diagnose instantaneous radiative forcing of ozone

Name: dxuo
Title: Eastward gridbox width on u points
Proposer name: Jenny Mecking – Ocean and Sea Ice Author Team – National Oceanography Centre – Climate and Uncertainty group
Justification for inclusion: To be able to do accurate calculations for the ocean model the width of the gridboxes in both the east/west and north/south direction is essential. This is particularly true if ocean transects are being investigated. Furthermore, attempting to estimate these parameters using the longitudes and latitudes from the t,u and v grid points often leads to incorrect values due to some models artificially narrowing channels (e.g. Strait of Gibraltar and between various islands in the Indonesian Through flow region.

Name: fddtdip
Title: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Phosphorus
Description: vertical integral of net  time rate of change of phosphate

Name: sispeed
Title: Sea-Ice Speed
Description: Speed of ice (i.e. mean absolute velocity) to account for back-and-forth movement of the ice

Name: tsnl
Title: Temperature Profile in the Snow
Description: Temperature in the snow pack present in the grid cell. 3D variable for multi-layer snow schemes.

Name: rsdcsbnd
Title: Downwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation at Each Level for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Name: epc100
Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Description: The phrase 'expressed\_as' is used in the construction A\_expressed\_as\_B, where B is a chemical constituent of A. It means that the quantity indicated by the standard name is calculated solely with respect to the B contained in A, neglecting all other chemical constituents of A. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Name: n2oglobal
Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of N2O
Description: Global mean Nitrous Oxide (N2O)

Name: zsatcalc
Title: Calcite Saturation Depth
Description: Depth of calcite saturation horizon (0 if undersaturated at all depths, and missing saturated through whole depth; if two or more horizons exist, then the shallowest is reported)

Name: va200
Title: Northward wind at 200 hPa
Justification for inclusion: Northward wind at 200hPa, 6 hurly instantaneous, when combined with the 250hPa version of this parameter can be used to compute deep layer shear.

Name: spco2nat
Title: Natural Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2. In ocean biogeochemistry models, a "natural analogue" is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure difference between sea water and air is positive when the partial pressure of the dissolved gas in sea water is greater than the partial pressure in air.

Name: talkos
Title: Surface Total Alkalinity
Description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, borate, phosphorus, silicon, and nitrogen components)

Name: od550ss
Title: Sea-Salt Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to sea salt aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: cLitterSubSurf
Title: Carbon Mass in Below-Ground Litter
Description: subsurface litter pool fed by root inputs.

Name: ccldncl
Title: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Convective Cloud Tops
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Name: ccb
Title: Air Pressure at Convective Cloud Base
Description: Where convective cloud is present in the grid cell, the instantaneous cloud base altitude should be that of the bottom of the lowest level containing convective cloud. Missing data should be reported in the absence of convective cloud. The time mean should be calculated from these quantities averaging over occasions when convective cloud is present only, and should contain missing data for occasions when no convective cloud is present during the meaning period.

Name: siflfwbot
Title: Freshwater Flux from Sea Ice
Description: Total flux of fresh water from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; This flux is negative during ice growth (liquid water mass decreases, hence upward flux of freshwater), positive during ice melt (liquid water mass increases, hence downward flux of freshwater)

Name: wbgt2mmax
Title: maximum 2m daily wet bulb globe temperature
Justification for inclusion: Important for the estimation of heat stress on human health

Name: prsn
Title: Snowfall Flux
Description: At surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase

Name: ps
Title: Surface Air Pressure
Description: surface pressure (not mean sea-level pressure), 2-D field to calculate the 3-D pressure field from hybrid coordinates

Name: agessc
Title: Sea Water Age Since Surface Contact
Description: Time elapsed since water was last in surface layer of the ocean.

Name: vsfsit
Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Sea Ice Thermodynamics
Description: This variable measures the virtual salt flux into sea water due to the melting of sea ice. It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

Name: co3natos
Title: Surface Natural Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the natural-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

Name: mrlso
Title: Soil Liquid Water Content
Description: The mass (summed over all all layers) of liquid water.

Name: emilkch4
Title: Freshwater lake emissions of CH4
Justification for inclusion: To calculate methane budgets with new methane emissions-driven modelling capability

Name: hfibthermds
Title: Heat Flux into Sea Water Due to Iceberg Thermodynamics
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  " Iceberg thermodynamics" refers to the addition or subtraction of mass due to surface and basal fluxes, i.e., due to melting, sublimation and fusion.

Name: cLitterSurf
Title: Carbon Mass in Above-Ground Litter
Description: Surface or near-surface litter pool fed by leaf and above-ground litterfall

Name: co2
Title: Mole Fraction of CO2
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: litemptopIs
Title: Ice Sheet Temperature at Top of Ice Sheet Model
Description: Upper boundary temperature that is used to force ice sheet models. It is the temperature at the base of the snowpack models, and does not vary with seasons. Report surface temperature of ice sheet where snow thickness is zero

Name: h2prod
Title: chemical production of atmospheric H2
Justification for inclusion: To calculate hydrogen budget

Name: clwvic
Title: Convective Condensed Water Path
Description: calculate mass of convective condensed (liquid + ice) water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: fNProduct
Title: Deforested or Harvested Biomass as a Result of Anthropogenic Land-Use or Change
Description: When land use change results in deforestation of natural vegetation (trees or grasslands) then natural biomass is removed. The treatment of deforested biomass differs significantly across models, but it should be straight-forward to compare deforested biomass across models.

Name: graz
Title: Total Grazing of Phytoplankton by Zooplankton
Description: Total grazing of phytoplankton by zooplankton defined as tendency of moles of carbon per cubic metre.

Name: dcalc
Title: Calcite Dissolution
Description: Rate of change of Calcite carbon mole concentration  due to dissolution

Name: phycnano
Title: carbon concentration of nanophytoplankton
Justification for inclusion: Requested by Fish-MIP as part of ISIMIP. Needed for model intercomparisons for marine biodiversity and ecosystems.

Name: seawpp
Title: Sea Wave Peak Period
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of the wave model's output

Name: mcd
Title: Downdraft Convective Mass Flux
Description: Calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

Name: o2sat
Title: Dissolved Oxygen Concentration at Saturation
Description: "Mole concentration at saturation" means the mole concentration in a saturated solution. Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen".

Name: lat
Title: Latitude
Description: Latitude is positive northward; its units of degree\_north (or equivalent) indicate this explicitly. In a latitude-longitude system defined with respect to a rotated North Pole, the standard name of grid\_latitude should be used instead of latitude. Grid latitude is positive in the grid-northward direction, but its units should be plain degree.

Name: ch3coch3
Title: CH3COCH3 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction "mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". Acetone is an organic molecule with the chemical formula CH3CH3CO. The IUPAC name for acetone is propan-2-one. Acetone is a member of the group of organic compounds known as ketones. There are standard names for the ketone group as well as for some of the individual species.

Name: flashrate
Title: Lightning Flash Rate
Description: proposed name: lightning\_flash\_rate (units to be interpreted as "counts km-2 s-1)

Name: co3nat
Title: Natural Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the natural-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). A natural analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable of imposing preindustrial atmospheric carbon dioxide concentrations, even when the model as a whole may be subjected to varying forcings.

Name: albdiffbnd
Title: Diffuse Surface Albedo for Each Band
Description: The fraction of the surface diffuse downwelling shortwave radiation flux which is reflected. If the diffuse radiation is isotropic, this term is equivalent to the integral of surface bidirectional reflectance over all incident angles and over all outgoing angles in the hemisphere above the surface. Reported in spectral frequency bands.

Name: phabioos
Title: Surface Abiotic pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Name: grplmxrat
Title: Graupel Mixing Ratio
Description: Graupel mixing ratio

Name: masscello
Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Mass per Area
Description: Tracer grid-cell mass per unit area used for computing tracer budgets. For Boussinesq models with static ocean grid cell thickness, masscello = rhozero\*thickcello, where thickcello is static cell thickness and rhozero is constant Boussinesq reference density. More generally, masscello is time dependent and reported as part of Omon.
Processing Comment: If constant, report as a fixed configuration field, otherwise report as time varying.
Comments: Clearly labelling where there are choices between variables.

Name: sifb
Title: Sea-Ice Freeboard
Description: Mean height of sea-ice surface (=snow-ice interface when snow covered) above sea level

Name: hur500
Title: Relatie humidity at 500 hPa
Justification for inclusion: Relative humidity at 500 hPa at 6 hourly instantaneous timescales can be useful for diagnosing convection/MCS & frontal environments

Name: sistressave
Title: Average Normal Stress in Sea Ice
Description: Average normal stress in sea ice (first stress invariant)
Comments: Inconsistency in names of sea ice stress terms

Name: uaUTLS
Title: '6 hourly instantaneous northward wind at 3 pressure levels in the UTLS region (150, 200, and 250 hPa) '
Justification for inclusion: Requested to study impacts on aviation. Needed to diagnose clear air turbulence.

Name: siextents
Title: Sea-Ice Extent South
Description: Total area of all Southern-Hemisphere grid cells that are covered by at least 15 % areal fraction of sea ice

Name: deptho
Title: Sea Floor Depth Below Geoid
Description: Ocean bathymetry.   Reported here is the sea floor depth for present day relative to z=0 geoid. Reported as missing for land grid cells.

Name: stratch4loss
Title: Loss of CH4 due to chemical destruction in the stratosphere
Justification for inclusion: To calculate methane budgets with new methane emissions-driven modelling capability

Name: prlsns
Title: Stratiform Snowfall Flux
Description: large-scale precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase.

Name: epfe100
Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Iron
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Name: si
Title: Total Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". "Dissolved inorganic silicon" means the sum of all inorganic silicon in solution (including silicic acid and its first dissociated anion SiO(OH)3-).

Name: sivol
Title: Sea-Ice Volume per Area
Description: Total volume of sea ice divided by grid-cell area (this used to be called ice thickness in CMIP5)

Name: hflsLut
Title: Latent Heat Flux on Land-Use Tile
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: zmicroos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Name: chlpicoos
Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Name: fddtalk
Title: Rate of Change of Total Alkalinity
Description: vertical integral of net time rate of change of alkalinity

Name: pr
Title: Precipitation
Description: includes both liquid and solid phases

Name: tnpeo
Title: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content
Description: Rate that work is done against vertical stratification, as measured by the vertical heat and salt diffusivity. Report here as depth integrated two-dimensional field.

Name: c13Litter
Title: Mass of 13C in Litter Pool
Description: Carbon-13 mass content per unit area litter (dead plant material in or above the soil).

Name: h2
Title: H2 volume mixing ratio
Justification for inclusion: To understand the budget of molecular hydrogen

Name: intppnano
Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by nanophytoplankton
Justification for inclusion: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the nanophytoplankton component alone

Name: fddtdic
Title: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Carbon
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" describes a family of chemical species in solution, including carbon dioxide, carbonic acid and the carbonate and bicarbonate anions. "Dissolved inorganic carbon" is the term used in standard names for all species belonging to the family that are represented within a given model. The list of individual species that are included in a quantity having a group chemical standard name can vary between models.  Where possible, the data variable should be accompanied by a complete description of the species represented, for example, by using a comment attribute.

Name: tnpeotb
Title: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content Due to Background
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  Potential energy is the sum of the gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the centripetal potential energy. (The geopotential is the specific potential energy.)  "Due to background" means caused by a time invariant imposed field which may be either constant over the globe or spatially varying, depending on the ocean model used. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Name: msftyzmpa
Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.
Processing Comment: For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid this should be omitted.

Name: sfdsi
Title: Downward Sea Ice Basal Salt Flux
Description: This field is physical, and it arises since sea ice has a nonzero salt content, so it exchanges salt with the liquid ocean upon melting and freezing.

Name: clmodisice
Title: MODIS Ice-Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Justification for inclusion: Same as clmodisliquid, but this parameter can be used to estimate the SW ERFaci from ice clouds. This would be most useful in GCMs that capture at least some of the _aerosol effects on ice clouds, _and might also prove useful to understand how different degrees of ice-aerosol representations in models lead to differences in aerosol forcing_. _This parameter could also be used in a similar fashion to _clmodis_ as a test on how well models simulate ice cloud _amount_ as well as ice cloud _distribution_ (in CTP-COT or r\_e-IWP space).
Atmosphere review comments: Atmosphere team are happy with the technical description of the parameters and confirmed there is precedent for the modis naming convention. The IPO has reached out to the proposer to inform that an accepted physical parameter does not indicate inclusion into the Data Request - the physical parameter must be assigned to a Variable, which in turn must be assigned a variable group and opportunity to ensure inclusion.

Name: tauucorr
Title: Sea Water Surface Downward X Stress Correction
Description: This is the stress on the liquid ocean from overlying atmosphere, sea ice, ice shelf, etc.

Name: msftyzsmpa
Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Report only if there is a submesoscale eddy parameterization.
Processing Comment: For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid this should be omitted.

Name: darag
Title: Aragonite Dissolution
Description: Rate of change of Aragonite carbon mole concentration  due to dissolution

Name: so
Title: Sea Water Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Name: fracOutLut
Title: Annual Gross Percentage of Land-Use Tile That Was Transferred into Other Land-Use Tiles
Description: Cumulative percentage transitions over the year; note that percentage should be reported as percentage of atmospheric grid cell

Name: lwsnl
Title: Liquid Water Content of Snow Layer
Description: The total mass of liquid water contained interstitially within the whole depth of the snow layer of the land portion of a grid cell divided by the area of the land portion of the cell.

Name: sitimefrac
Title: Fraction of Time Steps with Sea Ice
Description: Fraction of time steps of the averaging period during which sea ice is present (siconc >0 ) in a grid cell

Name: jo3
Title: Photolysis Rate of Ozone (O3)
Description: Sum of photolysis rates o3 -> o1d+o2 and o3 -> o+o2

Name: dxvo
Title: Eastward gridbox width on v points
Proposer name: Jenny Mecking – Ocean and Sea Ice Author Team – National Oceanography Centre – Climate and Uncertainty group
Justification for inclusion: To be able to do accurate calculations for the ocean model the width of the gridboxes in both the east/west and north/south direction is essential. This is particularly true if ocean transects are being investigated. Furthermore, attempting to estimate these parameters using the longitudes and latitudes from the t,u and v grid points often leads to incorrect values due to some models artificially narrowing channels (e.g. Strait of Gibraltar and between various islands in the Indonesian Through flow region.)

Name: bddtdisi
Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Silicon Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicon

Name: sweLut
Title: Snow Water Equivalent on Land-Use Tile
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "lwe" means liquid water equivalent. "Amount" means mass per unit area. The construction lwe\_thickness\_of\_X\_amount or \_content means the vertical extent of a layer of liquid water having the same mass per unit area. Surface amount refers to the amount on the ground, excluding that on the plant or vegetation canopy.

Name: dtauc
Title: Convective Cloud Optical Depth
Description: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell

Name: wetno3
Title: Wet deposition of nitrate aerosol
Justification for inclusion: To calculate nitrogen and nitrate aerosol budgets

Name: loadpoa
Title: Load of Dry Aerosol Primary Organic Matter
Description: The total dry mass of primary particulate organic aerosol particles per unit area.

Name: vegHeightTree
Title: Height of Trees
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the tree fraction of a grid cell.

Name: intpbp
Title: Phosphorus Production
Description: Vertically integrated biogenic phosphorus production

Name: rlu
Title: Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling longwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Name: diabdrag

Name: clmodisliquid
Title: MODIS Liquid-Topped Cloud Area Fraction
Justification for inclusion: The MODIS instrument simulator is capable of producing cloud fraction joint histograms akin to those from the ISCCP satellite simulator, but can further partition them by cloud-top phase. Furthermore, two versions of the joint histogram exist: one that aligns with the cloud-top pressure & cloud optical depth (CTP-COT) dimensions of the existing ISCCP histograms, and another partitioned by cloud droplet effective radius (r\_e) and cloud liquid water path (LWP). This latter version can used in conjunction with cloud radiative kernels to estimate both the SW effective radiative forcing from aerosol-cloud interactions (SW ERFaci) from liquid clouds, and also the relative contributions of the Twomey effect, LWP adjustment, and cloud-fraction (CF) adjustment separately. This is a new technique that adopts a decomposition framework from the cloud feedback literature ([Zelinka 2012a](https://eur05.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjournals.ametsoc.org%2Fview%2Fjournals%2Fclim%2F25%2F11%2Fjcli-d-11-00248.1.xml%3Ftab_body%3Dabstract-display&data=05%7C02%7CElisabeth.Dingley%40ext.esa.int%7Cd5a18aa3c0c94a4149ea08dcb5730745%7C9a5cacd02bef4dd7ac5c7ebe1f54f495%7C0%7C0%7C638584752864945047%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=0Ie0IdDPCr0pGBxlt0T16HO7vUfyzUbHnPzo1aqUQys%3D&reserved=0) and [Zelinka 2013](https://eur05.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjournals.ametsoc.org%2Fview%2Fjournals%2Fclim%2F26%2F14%2Fjcli-d-12-00555.1.xml&data=05%7C02%7CElisabeth.Dingley%40ext.esa.int%7Cd5a18aa3c0c94a4149ea08dcb5730745%7C9a5cacd02bef4dd7ac5c7ebe1f54f495%7C0%7C0%7C638584752864952800%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=mlEna4KNYajh34b%2FFpZK4AMBlwGH%2BBb5wlGLbWcfHSs%3D&reserved=0)). It has been used in observations by [Wall 2023](https://eur05.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Facp.copernicus.org%2Farticles%2F23%2F13125%2F2023%2F&data=05%7C02%7CElisabeth.Dingley%40ext.esa.int%7Cd5a18aa3c0c94a4149ea08dcb5730745%7C9a5cacd02bef4dd7ac5c7ebe1f54f495%7C0%7C0%7C638584752864959609%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=QqdnpJwKxh%2BxfOArXdxMbwgIYa5WLrAUzWCY0%2B1V10c%3D&reserved=0), and a manuscript highlighting its first use in a GCM is nearing completion and will be submitted to ACP in the coming weeks.

Name: clmodis
Title: Modis Cloud Area Fraction
Justification for inclusion: This parameter is similar to _clisccp_, the existing 7x7 joint histogram of cloud fraction, partitioned by cloud-top pressure (CTP) and cloud optical depth (COT). This parameter alone is an important metric for comparing the simulation of clouds across models, given the differences between the MODIS and ISCCP instrument simulators (summarized in [Pincus et al 2012](https://eur05.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjournals.ametsoc.org%2Fview%2Fjournals%2Fclim%2F25%2F13%2Fjcli-d-11-00267.1.xml&data=05%7C02%7CElisabeth.Dingley%40ext.esa.int%7Cd5a18aa3c0c94a4149ea08dcb5730745%7C9a5cacd02bef4dd7ac5c7ebe1f54f495%7C0%7C0%7C638584752864920723%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=ATWFk2FgzgikZKn86KzeC6sZWzk1P7qICZos2SW4bbU%3D&reserved=0)). Furthermore, it is an important supplement to _clmodisice _and _clmodisliquid_, as it can be used to decompose forcing from liquid- and ice-clouds into their "true" components by accounting for obscuration effects (ie, removing the component of aerosol forcing from liquid clouds that comes from changes in overlying ice clouds, rather than changes from the liquid clouds themselves). Furthermore, this metric can be used as output in historical simulations to compare MODIS simulator output from a GCM to MODIS observations to evaluate model performance (as in [Klein 2013,](https://eur05.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fagupubs.onlinelibrary.wiley.com%2Fdoi%2Ffull%2F10.1002%2Fjgrd.50141&data=05%7C02%7CElisabeth.Dingley%40ext.esa.int%7Cd5a18aa3c0c94a4149ea08dcb5730745%7C9a5cacd02bef4dd7ac5c7ebe1f54f495%7C0%7C0%7C638584752864934620%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=lYOP6ftNOiR%2B64ObT5%2BGRCyd26gOnT%2BxegT2HM3lKT8%3D&reserved=0) but using the MODIS simulator).

Name: aoanh
Title: Northern Hemisphere Tracer Lifetime
Description: Fixed surface layer mixing ratio over 30o-50oN (0 ppbv), uniform fixed source (at all levels) everywhere else (source is unspecified but must be constant in space and time and documented). Note that the source could be 1yr/yr, so the tracer concentration provides mean age in years. For method using linearly increasing tracer include a method attribute: "linearly increasing tracer"For method using uniform source (1yr/yr) include a method attribute: "uniform source"

Name: ficeberg
Title: Water Flux into Sea Water from Icebergs
Description: computed as the iceberg melt water  flux into the ocean divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.
Processing Comment: If only the vertically integrated melt water flux is available, report as this 2-d field; otherwise as 3-d.

Name: hfevapds
Title: Temperature Flux Due to Evaporation Expressed as Heat Flux out of Sea Water
Description: This is defined as "where ice\_free\_sea over sea"

Name: fbddtalk
Title: Rate of Change of Biological Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Description: vertical integral of net biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity

Name: ppmisc
Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Other Phytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by other phytoplankton components alone

Name: difmxylo
Title: Ocean Momentum XY Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Lateral Laplacian viscosity applied to the momentum equations.

Name: frn
Title: Nitrogen Loss to Sediments and Through Denitrification
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase. 'Denitrification' is the conversion of nitrate into gaseous compounds such as nitric oxide, nitrous oxide and molecular nitrogen which are then emitted to the atmosphere.  'Sedimentation' is the sinking of particulate matter to the floor of a body of water. "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Name: sisndmasswindrif
Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Wind Drift of Snow
Description: the rate of change of snow mass through wind drift of snow (from sea-ice into the sea) divided by sea-ice area
Comments: "Change names of snow-on-sea-ice terms to start with ""sisn"""

Name: c2h4
Title: C2H4 volume mixing ratio
Justification for inclusion: To understand VOC budgets

Name: rluscs
Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation Clear Sky
Justification for inclusion: It was effectively assumed that the surface has an emissivity of 1.0 so people could use the all-sky upwelling flux. This is not the case for modern climate models which use emissivities < 1.0 which results in local differences of several W/m^2. This affects the ability to compute clear-sky surface budgets and cloud radiative effect.
Atmosphere review comments copy: Variable naming matches existing clear sky terms. Should be accepted.

Name: tauvogw
Title: Northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Justification for inclusion: Gravity wave momentum fluxes are the key quantity within the gravity wave parameterization schemes. Their divergence results to the drag on the background flow. Also, they are much easier comparable to observations than the drags themselves.
Proposed CF Standard Name: Northward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization

Name: od550bc
Title: Black Carbon Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to black carbon aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: mmrso4
Title: Aerosol Sulfate Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass of sulfate (SO4) in aerosol particles as a fraction of air mass.

Name: drydust
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of Dust
Description: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

Name: c4PftFrac
Title: Percentage Cover by C4 Plant Functional Type
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by C4 PFTs (including grass and crops).

Name: zostoga
Title: Global Average Thermosteric Sea Level Change
Description: There is no CMIP6 request for zosga nor zossga.

Name: tas
Title: Near-Surface Air Temperature
Description: near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature

Name: od440aer
Title: Ambient Aerosol Optical Thickness at 440nm
Description: AOD from the ambient aerosols (i.e., includes aerosol water).  Does not include AOD from stratospheric aerosols if these are prescribed but includes other possible background aerosol types. Needs a comment attribute "wavelength: 440nm"

Name: od550aerso
Title: Stratospheric Optical Depth at 550nm (All Aerosols) 2D-Field (Stratosphere Only)
Description: From tropopause to stratopause as defined by the model

Name: ztp
Title: Tropopause Altitude Above Geoid
Description: 2D monthly mean thermal tropopause calculated using WMO tropopause definition on 3d temperature

Name: sifllwutop
Title: Upwelling Longwave Flux over Sea Ice
Description: the upwelling longwave flux over sea ice (always negative)

Name: rsucsaf
Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds (following Ghan). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Name: raRoot
Title: Total Respiration from Roots as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total autotrophic respiration from all belowground plant parts.  This has benchmarking value because the sum of Rh and root respiration can be compared to observations of total soil respiration.

Name: pppico
Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
Description: Primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Name: clivimodis
Title: MODIS Ice Water Path
Justification for inclusion: To evaluate clouds in climate model by comparing with satellite observations the output of satellite simulators allows for a more quantitative comparison of model and satellite data. Until now only cloud coverage is part of the physical variables in the CMOR tables. Additional insight into the models’ performance in reproducing observed cloud properties is expected from using additional output from the COSP satellite simulator package, in particular ice and liquid water path resembling MODIS measurements.

Name: bs550aer
Title: Aerosol Backscatter Coefficient
Description: Aerosol  Backscatter at 550nm and 180 degrees, computed from extinction and lidar ratio

Name: fNLandToOcean
Title: Lateral Transfer of Nitrogen out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Description: leached nitrogen etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

Name: sithick
Title: Sea Ice Thickness
Description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice (NOT volume divided by grid area as was done in CMIP5)

Name: psitem
Title: Transformed Eulerian Mean Mass Streamfunction
Description: Residual mass streamfunction, computed from vstar and integrated from the top of the atmosphere (on the native model grid). Reference: Andrews et al (1987): Middle Atmospheric Dynamics. Academic Press.

Name: mpw
Title: Total Waves Mean Period
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of the variables for wave model's outputs

Name: intdoc
Title: Dissolved Organic Carbon Content
Description: Vertically integrated DOC (explicit pools only)

Name: tnhusa
Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Advection
Description: Tendency of Specific Humidity due to Advection

Name: mrfso
Title: Soil Frozen Water Content
Description: The mass per unit area (summed over all model layers) of frozen water.

Name: chepnh4
Title: Net chemical production of ammonium aerosol
Justification for inclusion: To calculate ammonium aerosol budget

Name: snowmxrat
Title: Mass Fraction of Snow in Air
Description: Snow mixing ratio

Name: rsdt
Title: TOA Incident Shortwave Radiation
Description: Shortwave radiation incident at the top of the atmosphere

Name: fgcfc12
Title: Surface Downward CFC12 Flux
Description: gas exchange flux of CFC12

Name: cLitterTree
Title: Carbon Mass in Litter on Tree Tiles
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Name: emic2h4
Title: Total emission rate of ethene
Justification for inclusion: To understand VOC budgets

Name: co3abio
Title: Abiotic Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the abiotic-analogue carbonate anion (CO3). An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

Name: od550soa
Title: Particulate Organic Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: Total organic aerosol AOD due to secondary aerosol  at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: laiLut
Title: Leaf Area Index on Land-Use Tile
Description: A ratio obtained by dividing the total upper leaf surface area of vegetation by the (horizontal) surface area of the land on which it grows.

Name: litempbotgr
Title: Basal Temperature of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: Basal temperature that is used to force the ice sheet models, it is the temperature AT ice sheet - bedrock interface. Cell\_methods: area: mean where grounded\_ice\_sheet

Name: rac13
Title: Carbon-13 Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Autotrophic (Plant) Respiration on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon-13 into the atmosphere due to plant respiration. Plant respiration is the sum of respiration by parts of plants both above and below the soil. It is assumed that all the respired carbon dioxide is emitted to the atmosphere.

Name: aerssabnd
Title: Aerosol Level Single Scattering Albedo for Each Band
Description: The single scattering albedo is the fraction of radiation in an incident light beam scattered by the particles of an aerosol reference volume for a given wavelength. It is the ratio of the scattering and the extinction coefficients of the aerosol particles in the reference volume.

Name: gppTree
Title: Gross Primary Production on Tree Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total GPP of trees in the grid cell

Name: chldiatos
Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll from diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Name: fLitterFire
Title: Carbon Mass Flux from Litter, CWD or any non-Living Pool into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from All Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Required for unambiguous separation of vegetation and soil + litter turnover times, since total fire flux draws from both sources

Name: lwtoacsaer
Title: TOA Clear-Sky Longwave Radiative Forcing Due to Aerosols
Description: Instantaneous forcing is the radiative flux change caused instantaneously by an imposed change in radiative forcing agent (greenhouse gases, aerosol, solar radiation, etc.).

Name: topg
Title: Bedrock Altitude
Description: The bedrock topography beneath the land ice

Name: thetaot300
Title: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 300m
Description: Upper 300m, 2D field

Name: iareafl
Title: Area Covered by Floating Ice Shelves
Description: Total area of the floating ice shelves (the component of ice sheet that flows over ocean)

Name: siage
Title: Age of Sea Ice
Description: Age of sea ice

Name: emic2h5oh
Title: Total emission rate of ethanol
Justification for inclusion: To understand VOC budgets

Name: drynh4
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of NH4
Description: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

Name: tauuogw
Title: Westward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization
Justification for inclusion: Gravity wave momentum fluxes are the key quantity within the gravity wave parameterization schemes. Their divergence results to the drag on the background flow. Also, they are much easier comparable to observations than the drags themselves.
Proposed CF Standard Name: Westward Reynolds stress from orographic gravity wave parameterization

Name: tos
Title: Sea Surface Temperature
Description: Temperature of upper boundary of the liquid ocean, including temperatures below sea-ice and floating ice shelves.

Name: emibbdms
Title: total emission of DMS from all biomass burning
Justification for inclusion: To understand sources of sulfur and sulfate aerosol in mocels

Name: zmtnt
Title: Zonal Mean Diabatic Heating Rates
Description: The diabatic heating rates due to all the processes that may change potential temperature

Name: hurs
Title: Near-Surface Relative Humidity
Description: The relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.

Name: ares
Title: Aerodynamic Resistance
Description: The "aerodynamic\_resistance" is the resistance to mixing through the boundary layer toward the surface by means of the dominant process, turbulent transport. Reference: Wesely, M. L., 1989,  doi:10.1016/0004-6981(89)90153-4.

Name: cfc11
Title: Mole Concentration of CFC11 in Sea Water
Description: Mole concentration means number of moles per unit volume, also called "molarity", and is used in the construction "mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y", where X is a material constituent of Y. A chemical or biological species denoted by X may be described by a single term such as "nitrogen" or a phrase such as "nox\_expressed\_as\_nitrogen". The chemical formula of CFC11 is CFCl3. The IUPAC name for CFC11 is trichloro-fluoro-methane.

Name: rsuscsafbnd
Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation in Bands
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds, following Ghan (ACP, 2013). This requires a double-call in the radiation code with precisely the same meteorology.

Name: co3satcalcos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Calcite in Sea Water
Description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure calcite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Name: raStem
Title: Total Respiration from Stem as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with Ra\_root

Name: uboluso
Title: eastward bolus sea water velocity
Proposer name: Jenny Mecking - Ocean and Sea Ice Author Group - Climate and Uncertainty - National Oceanography Centre
Justification for inclusion: This variable is essential to be able to accurately assess ocean circulation and transports.  The bolus (parameterized) velocity is particularly important in regions where there is a lot of eddy activity, like gyre boundaries and in the Southern Ocean.  In the Southern Ocean without the bolus velocities the transports are often incorrect/in the wrong direction.

Name: tsland
Title: Land Surface Temperature
Description: Temperature of the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Name: sftgrf
Title: Grounded Ice Sheet Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by grounded ice sheet

Name: albisccp
Title: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo
Description: ISCCP Mean Cloud Albedo. Time-means are weighted by the ISCCP Total Cloud Fraction {:cltisccp} - see  <http://cfmip.metoffice.com/COSP.html>

Name: bfe
Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Iron in Sea Water
Description: Sum of particulate organic iron component concentrations

Name: fahLut
Title: Anthropogenic Heat Flux Generated from non-Renewable Human Primary Energy Consumption
Description: Anthropogenic heat flux generated from non-renewable human primary energy consumption, including energy use by vehicles, commercial and residential buildings, industry, and power plants.  Primary energy refers to energy in natural resources, fossil and nonfossil, before conversion into other forms, such as electricity.

Name: fVegLitter
Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Vegetation" means any living plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_mortality and mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation\_due\_to\_senescence is mass\_flux\_of\_carbon\_into\_litter\_from\_vegetation.

Name: phycos
Title: Sea Surface Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of phytoplankton organic carbon component concentrations at the sea surface

Name: nwdFracLut
Title: Non-Woody Vegetation Percentage Cover
Description: Percentage of land use tile tile that is non-woody vegetation ( e.g. herbaceous crops)

Name: nLeaf
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Leaves
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.

Name: prc
Title: Convective Precipitation
Description: Convective precipitation at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.

Name: c2h2
Title: C2H2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: tnhusc
Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity Due to Convection
Description: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.

Name: reffclic
Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Cloud Ice
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Name: zg925
Title: Geopotential height at 925 hPa
Justification for inclusion: Geopotential height at 925 hPa and 6 hourly instantaneous is useful to classify various types of low pressure systems

Name: emianox
Title: Total Emission Rate of Anthropogenic NOx
Description: Store flux as Nitrogen. Anthropogenic fraction. NOx=NO+NO2, Includes agricultural waste burning but no other biomass burning. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: rld
Title: Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: Downwelling Longwave Radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Name: sconcso4
Title: Surface Concentration of SO4
Description: mass concentration of sulfate dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer.

Name: cltisccp
Title: ISCCP Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the International Satellite Cloud Climatology Project (ISCCP) analysis. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.  (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: prlsprof
Title: Stratiform Rainfall Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.  Stratiform precipitation, whether liquid or frozen, is precipitation that formed in stratiform cloud.

Name: nStem
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Stem
Description: including sapwood and hardwood.

Name: rsuscs
Title: Surface Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface Upwelling Clear-sky Shortwave Radiation

Name: prsn18O
Title: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-18 isotope (H2 18O), including solid phase only.

Name: evs
Title: Water Evaporation Flux Where Ice Free Ocean over Sea
Description: computed as the total mass of water vapor evaporating from the ice-free portion of the ocean  divided by the area of the ocean portion of the grid cell.

Name: bddtalk
Title: Rate of Change of Alkalinity Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net total of biological terms in time rate of change of alkalinity

Name: rlds
Title: Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: prw
Title: Water Vapor Path
Description: vertically integrated through the atmospheric column

Name: wpp
Title: Total Waves Peak Period
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of the wave model's outputs

Name: clmisr
Title: Percentage Cloud Cover as Calculated by the MISR Simulator (Including Error Flag)
Description: Cloud percentage in spectral bands and layers as observed by the Multi-angle Imaging SpectroRadiometer (MISR) instrument. The first layer in each profile is reserved for a retrieval error flag.

Name: hus
Title: Specific Humidity
Description: Specific humidity is the mass fraction of water vapor in (moist) air.

Name: clcalipsoliq
Title: CALIPSO Liquid Cloud Percentage
Description: Percentage liquid water ice cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

Name: swellwdir
Title: Swell waves Direction
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of the wave model's output

Name: intuaw
Title: Vertically Integrated Eastward Moisture Transport
Description: Vertically integrated Eastward moisture transport (Mass weighted vertical integral of the product of eastward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

Name: albc
Title: Canopy Albedo
Description: Albedo of the vegetation: fraction of incoming solar radiation which is reflected before reaching the ground.

Name: evspsblveg
Title: Evaporation from Canopy
Description: The canopy evaporation and sublimation (if present in model); may include dew formation as a negative flux.

Name: exparagob
Title: Sinking Flux of Aragonite Reaching the Ocean Bottom
Justification for inclusion: Aragonite is a secondary form of calcium carbonate in marine sediments. Understanding the total flux of calcium carbonate reaching the ocean bottom (as calcite and aragonite) would be important for understanding the ocean sediment response to climate change and ocean acidification.

Name: vtem
Title: Transformed Eulerian Mean Northward Wind
Description: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics v\*, meridional component of the residual meridional circulation (v\*, w\*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available).

Name: fco2fos
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Fossil Fuel Emissions of CO2 [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the prescribed anthropogenic CO2 flux from fossil fuel use, including cement production, and flaring (but not from land-use changes, agricultural burning, forest regrowth, etc.)

Name: cldwatmxrat
Title: Cloud Water Mixing Ratio
Description: Cloud water mixing ratio

Name: thetaot2000
Title: Depth Average Potential Temperature of Upper 2000m
Description: Upper 2000m, 2D field

Name: mrro
Title: Total Runoff
Description: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

Name: vsfevap
Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Evaporation
Description: zero for models using real water fluxes.

Name: bddtdife
Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Iron Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net total of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic iron

Name: co3os
Title: Surface Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

Name: phnatos
Title: Surface Natural pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1.

Name: limirrpico
Title: Irradiance Limitation of Picophytoplankton
Description: Growth limitation of picophytoplankton due to solar irradiance. "Growth limitation due to solar irradiance" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where the amount of sunlight reaching a location may be limited) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on solar irradiance.

Name: loadoa
Title: Load of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Description: atmosphere dry organic content: This is the vertically integrated sum of atmosphere\_primary\_organic\_content and atmosphere\_secondary\_organic\_content (see next two table entries).

Name: lossn2o
Title: Monthly Loss of Atmospheric Nitrous Oxide
Description: monthly averaged atmospheric loss

Name: dispkevfo
Title: Ocean Kinetic Energy Dissipation per Unit Area Due to Vertical Friction
Description: Friction, leading to the dissipation of kinetic energy, arises in ocean models as a result of the viscosity of sea water.  Generally, the  lateral (xy) viscosity is given a large value to maintain the numerical stability of the model.  In contrast, the vertical viscosity is usually much smaller. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.

Name: pathetao
Title: Sea Water Additional Potential Temperature
Description: The quantity with standard name sea\_water\_added\_potential\_temperature is a passive tracer in an ocean model whose surface flux does not come from the atmosphere but is imposed externally upon the simulated climate system. The surface flux is expressed as a heat flux and converted to a passive tracer increment as if it were a heat flux being added to potential temperature. The passive tracer is transported within the ocean as if it were potential temperature. The passive tracer is zero in the control climate of the model. The passive tracer records added heat, as described for the CMIP6 FAFMIP experiment (doi:10.5194/gmd-9-3993-2016), following earlier ideas. Potential temperature is the temperature a parcel of air or sea water would have if moved adiabatically to sea level pressure.
Comments: Clearly labelling where there are choices between variables.

Name: icfriver
Title: Flux of Inorganic Carbon into Ocean Surface by Runoff
Description: Inorganic Carbon supply to ocean through runoff (separate from gas exchange)

Name: cldicemxrat
Title: Cloud Ice Mixing Ratio
Description: Cloud ice mixing ratio

Name: tran
Title: Transpiration
Description: Transpiration (may include dew formation as a negative flux).

Name: bry
Title: Total Inorganic Bromine Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model) ; list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. Bry = Br + BrO + HOBr + HBr + BrONO2 + BrCl Definition: Total inorganic bromine (e.g., HBr and inorganic bromine oxides and radicals (e.g., BrO, atomic bromine (Br), bromine nitrate (BrONO2)) resulting from degradation of bromine-containing organic source gases (halons, methyl bromide, VSLS), and natural inorganic bromine sources (e.g., volcanoes, sea salt, and other aerosols) add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

Name: rsu4co2
Title: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Name: hfbasin
Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport
Description: Contains contributions from all physical processes affecting the northward heat transport, including resolved advection, parameterized advection, lateral diffusion, etc. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.   Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Name: siarean
Title: Sea-Ice Area North
Description: total area of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

Name: bsi
Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: Sum of particulate silica component concentrations

Name: difvmto
Title: Ocean Vertical Momentum Diffusivity Due to Tides
Description: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. The construction vertical\_X\_diffusivity means the vertical component of the diffusivity of X due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model. "Due to tides" means due to all astronomical gravity changes which manifest as tides. No distinction is made between different tidal components. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.

Name: tnkebto
Title: Tendency of Ocean Eddy Kinetic Energy Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Description: Depth integrated impacts on kinetic energy arising from parameterized eddy-induced advection. For CMIP5, this diagnostic was 3d, whereas the CMIP6 depth integrated diagnostic is sufficient for many purposes and reduces archive requirements.

Name: dpco2abio
Title: Abiotic Delta Pco Partial Pressure
Description: Difference in partial pressure of abiotic-analogue carbon dioxide between sea water and air.  The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. An abiotic analogue is used to simulate the effect on a modelled variable when biological effects on ocean carbon concentration and alkalinity are ignored.

Name: fVegSoilMortality
Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Mortality
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Name: vtendnogw
Title: Northward Acceleration Due to Non-Orographic Gravity Wave Drag
Description: Tendency of the northward wind by parameterized nonorographic gravity waves.  (Note that CF name tables only have a general northward tendency for all gravity waves, and we need it separated by type.)

Name: airmass
Title: Vertically Integrated Mass Content of Air in Layer
Description: The mass of air in an atmospheric layer.

Name: fNgas
Title: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Sum of NHx, NOx, N2O, N2)
Description: Total flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere.

Name: oxprod
Title: Total Odd Oxygen (Ox) Production Rate
Description: total production rate of o+o1d+o3 including o2 photolysis and all o3 producing reactions

Name: wap
Title: Omega (=dp/dt)
Description: Omega (vertical velocity in pressure coordinates, positive downwards)

Name: fNgasFire
Title: Total Nitrogen Lost to the Atmosphere (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2) from Fire
Description: Flux of Nitrogen from the land into the atmosphere due to fire

Name: sipr
Title: Rainfall Rate over Sea Ice
Description: mass of liquid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Name: fNLitterSoil
Title: Total Nitrogen Mass Flux from Litter to Soil
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil.

Name: areacellr
Title: Grid-Cell Area for River Model Variables
Description: For river routing model, if grid differs from the atmospheric grid.

Name: cSoilSlow
Title: Carbon Mass in Slow Soil Pool
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in slow soil pool. Slow means a lifetime of more than 100 years for reference climate (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

Name: diftrxylo
Title: Ocean Tracer XY Laplacian Diffusivity
Description: Diffusivity is also sometimes known as the coefficient of diffusion. Diffusion occurs as a result of a gradient in the spatial distribution of mass concentration, temperature or momentum.  The diffusivity may be very different in the vertical and horizontal directions. "xy diffusivity" means the lateral along\_coordinate component of diffusivity due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of the model.  xy diffusivities are used in some ocean models to counteract the numerical instabilities inherent in certain implementations of rotated neutral diffusion. "laplacian diffusivity" means diffusivity for use with a Laplacian diffusion operator.

Name: cSoilLevels
Title: Carbon Mass in Each Model Soil Level (Summed over All Soil Carbon Pools in That Level)
Description: for models with vertically discretised soil carbon, report total soil carbon for each level

Name: expc
Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon
Description: Downward flux of particulate organic carbon

Name: ppalg
Title: Algal Production
Justification for inclusion: Algal Production

Name: gppc13
Title: Carbon-13 Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: The rate of synthesis of carbon-13 in biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Name: intvadse
Title: Vertically Integrated Northward Dry Static Energy Transport
Description: Vertically integrated northward dry static energy transport (cp.T +zg).v (Mass\_weighted\_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by dry static\_energy per mass unit)

Name: phyn
Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Nitrogen in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton nitrogen component concentrations

Name: emih2
Title: Total emission rate of H2
Justification for inclusion: To understand the budget of molecular hydrogen

Name: vt100
Title: Northward Eddy Temperature Flux
Description: Zonally averaged eddy temperature flux at 100hPa as monthly means derived from daily (or higher frequency) fields.

Name: fCLandToOcean
Title: Lateral Transfer of Carbon out of Grid Cell That Eventually Goes into Ocean
Description: leached carbon etc that goes into run off or river routing and finds its way into ocean should be reported here.

Name: vegHeightPasture
Title: Height of Pastures
Description: Vegetation height averaged over the pasture fraction of a grid cell.

Name: reffrainc
Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Convective Rainfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Name: mmrdust
Title: Dust Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of dust aerosol particles in air.

Name: cfc113global
Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC113
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC113 is CCl2FCClF2.  The IUPAC name for CFC113 is 1,1,2-trichloro-1,2,2-trifluoro-ethane.

Name: netAtmosLandC14Flux
Title: Net Mass Flux of 14C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon-14 as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).

Name: wtd
Title: Water Table Depth
Description: Depth is the vertical distance below the surface. The water table is the surface below which the soil is saturated with water such that all pore spaces are filled.

Name: limfediat
Title: Iron Limitation of Diatoms
Description: Diatoms are phytoplankton with an external skeleton made of silica. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: sirdgthick
Title: Ridged Ice Thickness
Description: Sea Ice Ridge Height (representing mean height over the ridged area)

Name: mmrno3
Title: NO3 Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of nitrate aerosol particles in air.

Name: cCwd
Title: Carbon Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in woody debris (dead organic matter composed of coarse wood.  It is distinct from litter)

Name: sisnmassn
Title: Snow Mass on Sea-Ice North
Justification for inclusion: We propose to add this new physical parameter for the total mass of snow on sea ice over the Northern Hemisphere to compliment the other sea ice integrated total hemispheric diagnostics (siarean, siareas, siextentn, siextents, sivoln, and sivols) and allow for a complete high-level analysis of the total mass of the cryosphere in the Earth system.

Name: vortmean
Title: Relative Vorticity
Description: Mean vorticity over 850,700,600 hPa

Name: emibbbc
Title: total emission rate of black carbon aerosol mass from all biomass burning
Justification for inclusion: To understand sources of black carbon in models

Name: wetlandCH4cons
Title: Grid Averaged Methane Consumption (Methanotrophy) from Wetlands
Description: Biological consumption (methanotrophy) of methane (NH4) by wetlands (areas where water covers the soil, or is present either at or near the surface of the soil all year or for varying periods of time during the year, including during the growing season).

Name: hfbasinpsmadv
Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Submesoscale Advection
Description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced advective transport. Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Name: siforcecoriolx
Title: Coriolis Force Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by coriolis force

Name: solbnd
Title: TOA Solar Irradiance for Each Band
Description: Solar irradiance at a horizontal surface at top of atmosphere.

Name: raLeaf
Title: Total Respiration from Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with Ra\_root

Name: expp
Title: Sinking Particulate Organic Phosphorus Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Name: dissicabio
Title: Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: rh
Title: Total Heterotrophic Respiration on Land as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area into atmosphere due to heterotrophic respiration on land (respiration by consumers)

Name: siflswdbot
Title: Downwelling Shortwave Flux Under Sea Ice
Description: The downwelling shortwave flux underneath sea ice (always positive)

Name: jpdftaureicemodis
Title: MODIS Joint Distribution of Optical Thickness and Particle Size, Ice
Description: Joint probability distribution function, giving probability of cloud as a function of optical thickness and particle size, as measured by MODIS. For cloud ice particles.

Name: uas
Title: Eastward Near-Surface Wind
Description: Eastward component of the near-surface (usually, 10 meters)  wind
