Name: rsdscsaf
Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky, Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Calculated in the absence of aerosols and clouds.

Name: nMineralNO3
Title: Mineral Nitrate in the Soil
Description: SUM of nitrate over all soil layers

Name: concnmcn
Title: Number Concentration of Nucleation Mode Aerosol
Description: includes all particles with diameter smaller than 3 nm

Name: fNnetmin
Title: Net Nitrogen Release from Soil and Litter as the Outcome of Nitrogen Immobilisation and Gross Mineralisation
Description: Loss of soil nitrogen through remineralization and immobilisation. Remineralization is the degradation of organic matter into inorganic forms of carbon, nitrogen, phosphorus and other micronutrients, which consumes oxygen and releases energy. Immobilisation of nitrogen refers to retention of nitrogen by micro-organisms under certain conditions, making it unavailable for plants.

Name: mcu
Title: Convective Updraft Mass Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The atmosphere convective mass flux is the vertical transport of mass for a field of cumulus clouds or thermals, given by the product of air density and vertical velocity. For an area-average, cell\_methods should specify whether the average is over all the area or the area of updrafts only.

Name: wa
Title: Upward Air Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). Upward air velocity is the vertical component of the 3D air velocity vector. The standard name downward\_air\_velocity may be used for a vector component with the opposite sign convention.

Name: no
Title: NO Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: fAnthDisturb
Title: Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation, Litter or Soil Pools into the Atmosphere Due to any Human Activity [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Anthropogenic flux of carbon as carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. That is, emissions influenced, caused, or created by human activity. Anthropogenic emission of carbon dioxide includes fossil fuel use, cement production, agricultural burning and sources associated with anthropogenic land use change, except forest regrowth.

Name: sw18O
Title: Isotopic Ratio of Oxygen-18 in Sea Water
Description: Ratio of abundance of oxygen-18 (18O) atoms to oxygen-16 (16O) atoms in sea water

Name: sisaltmass
Title: Mass of Salt in Sea Ice per Area
Description: Total mass of all salt in sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Name: sino3
Title: Dissolved Nitrate Amount in Sea Ice
Justification for inclusion: Some CMIP7 models now have sea ice biogeochemistry included and are interested in saving these variables. Models that include sea-ice biogeochemistry support closing the carbon and nutrient s' cycles in the sea-ice zone.

Name: simass
Title: Sea-Ice Mass per Area
Description: Total mass of sea ice divided by grid-cell area

Name: areacello
Title: Grid-Cell Area for Ocean Variables
Description: Horizontal area of ocean grid cells
Processing Comment: If constant, report as a fixed configuration field, otherwise report as time varying.

Name: sidragtop
Title: Atmospheric Drag Coefficient
Description: Atmospheric drag coefficient that is used to calculate the atmospheric momentum drag on sea ice

Name: tnpeot
Title: Tendency of Ocean Potential Energy Content Due to Tides
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area.  Potential energy is the sum of the gravitational potential energy relative to the geoid and the centripetal potential energy. (The geopotential is the specific potential energy.)  "Due to tides" means due to all astronomical gravity changes which manifest as tides.  No distinction is made between different tidal components. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity  named by omitting the phrase.  "tendency\_of\_X" means derivative of X with respect to time.

Name: evu
Title: Eddy Viscosity Coefficient for Momentum
Description: Vertical diffusion coefficient for momentum due to parametrised eddies

Name: reffclwc
Title: Convective Cloud Liquid Droplet Effective Radius
Description: Droplets are liquid.  The effective radius is defined as the ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution and the time-mean should be calculated, weighting the individual samples by the cloudy fraction of the grid cell.

Name: sistryubot
Title: Y-Component of Ocean Stress on Sea Ice
Description: Y-component of ocean stress on sea ice

Name: nLitterCwd
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Coarse Woody Debris
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Wood debris" means dead organic matter composed of coarse wood. It is distinct from fine litter. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. The sum of the quantities with standard names wood\_debris\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen, surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_nitrogen is the total nitrogen mass content of dead plant material.

Name: snwc
Title: Snow Water Equivalent Intercepted by the Vegetation
Description: Total water mass of the snowpack (liquid or frozen), averaged over a grid cell and intercepted by the canopy.

Name: dtes
Title: Change in Surface Heat Storage
Description: Change in heat storage over the soil layer and the vegetation for which the energy balance is calculated, accumulated over the sampling time interval.

Name: msftbarot
Title: Ocean Barotropic Mass Streamfunction
Description: Streamfunction or its approximation for free surface models. See OMDP document for details.

Name: rlus
Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: sisndmasssnf
Title: Snow Mass Change Through Snow Fall
Description: mass of solid precipitation falling onto sea ice divided by sea-ice area
Comments: "Change names of snow-on-sea-ice terms to start with ""sisn"""

Name: chldiazos
Title: Surface Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Name: mmroa
Title: Total Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.

Name: mrroLut
Title: Total Runoff from Land-Use Tile
Description: the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land use tile portion of the grid cell

Name: bacc
Title: Bacterial Carbon Concentration
Description: Sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations

Name: rsntds
Title: Net Downward Shortwave Radiation at Sea Water Surface
Description: This is the flux into the surface of liquid sea water only. This excludes shortwave flux absorbed by sea ice, but includes any light that passes through the ice and is absorbed by the ocean.

Name: co2mass
Title: Total Atmospheric Mass of CO2
Description: Total atmospheric mass of Carbon Dioxide

Name: cProduct
Title: Carbon Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in that has been removed from the environment through  land use change.

Name: phypicoos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Name: vboluso
Title: northward bolus sea water velocity
Proposer name: Jenny Mecking - Ocean and Sea Ice author group - National Oceanography Centre - Climate and Uncertainty
Justification for inclusion: This variable is essential to be able to accurately assess ocean circulation and transports.  The bolus (parameterized) velocity is particularly important in regions where there is a lot of eddy activity, like gyre boundaries and in the Southern Ocean.  In the Southern Ocean without the bolus velocities the transports are often incorrect/in the wrong direction.

Name: albic
Title: Albedo of ice-covered Surface
Justification for inclusion: This is necessary to understand the response of the cryosphere in various climates

Name: hur850
Title: Relative humidity at 850 hPa
Justification for inclusion: Relative humidity at 6 hourly instantaneous frequencies on the 850 hPa level is useful to detect monsoon low pressure systems, convection/MCS & frontal environments

Name: loadnh4
Title: Load of NH4
Description: The total dry mass of ammonium aerosol particles per unit area.

Name: zg700
Title: Geopotential height at 700 hPa
Justification for inclusion: Geopotential height at 700 hPa, 6 hourly instantaneous is useful for classifying various types of low pressure systems.

Name: cropFracC4
Title: Percentage Cover by C4 Crops
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 crops

Name: lwtoafluxaerocs
Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: downwelling longwave flux due to volcanic aerosols at TOA under clear sky to be diagnosed through double radiation call

Name: dpo2
Title: Delta O2 Partial Pressure
Description: The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium.  The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume.  The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.

Name: nSoil
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Soil Pool
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: emidms
Title: Total Emission Rate of DMS
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: ta500
Title: Air Temperature
Description: Temperature on the 500 hPa surface

Name: ta
Title: Air Temperature
Description: Air Temperature

Name: obvfsq
Title: Square of Brunt Vaisala Frequency in Sea Water
Description: The phrase "square\_of\_X" means X\*X. Frequency is the number of oscillations of a wave per unit time. Brunt-Vaisala frequency is also sometimes called "buoyancy frequency" and is a measure of the vertical stratification of the medium.

Name: sw
Title: Surface Water Storage
Description: Total liquid water storage, other than soil, snow or interception storage (i.e. lakes, river channel or depression storage).

Name: sisnhc
Title: Snow Heat Content per Unit Area
Description: Heat-content of all snow in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Snow-water equivalent at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of sea ice.

Name: fVegSoilSenescence
Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Soil as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Name: phypico
Title: Mole Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Name: rlu4co2
Title: Upwelling Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold (includes the fluxes at the surface and TOA)

Name: nppVgt
Title: Net Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Justification for inclusion: This physical parameter allows to assess phenology simulated by models and the relative impact for future projections at vegetation type level.

Name: sistrydtop
Title: Y-Component of Atmospheric Stress on Sea Ice
Description: Y-component of atmospheric stress on sea ice

Name: dryoa
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of Dry Aerosol Total Organic Matter
Description: Tendency of atmosphere mass content of organic dry aerosol due to dry deposition: This is the sum of dry deposition of primary organic aerosol (POA) and dry deposition of secondary organic aerosol (SOA). Here, mass refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone.  We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available. Was called dry\_pom in old ACCMIP Excel table. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

Name: c3h8
Title: C3H8 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: tcs
Title: Vegetation Canopy Temperature
Description: Vegetation temperature, averaged over all vegetation types

Name: phymisc
Title: Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

Name: wtem
Title: Transformed Eulerian Mean Upward Wind
Description: Transformed Eulerian Mean Diagnostics w\*, upward component of the residual meridional circulation (v\*, w\*) derived from 6 hr or higher frequency data fields (use instantaneous daily fields or 12 hr fields if the 6 hr data are not available). Scale height: 6950 m

Name: libmassbfgr
Title: Basal Specific Mass Balance Flux of Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: Specific mass balance means the net rate at which ice is added per unit area at the land ice base.  A negative value means loss of ice. Computed as the total basal mass balance on the grounded land ice portion of the grid cell divided by grounded land ice area in the grid cell. Cell\_methods: area: mean where grounded\_ice\_sheet

Name: abs550dust
Title: dust absorption aerosol optical depth @550nm
Justification for inclusion: To unravel reason for model spread in direct aerosol effect

Name: tossq
Title: Square of Sea Surface Temperature
Description: Square of temperature of liquid ocean.

Name: hfbasinpmdiff
Title: Northward Ocean Heat Transport Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Description: Contributions to heat transport from parameterized mesoscale eddy-induced diffusive transport (i.e., neutral diffusion). Diagnosed here as a function of latitude and basin.

Name: phyc
Title: Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration
Description: sum of phytoplankton carbon component concentrations.  In most (all?) cases this is the sum of phycdiat and phycmisc (i.e., "Diatom Carbon Concentration" and "Non-Diatom Phytoplankton Carbon Concentration"

Name: sisndmasssi
Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Snow-to-Ice Conversion
Description: the rate of change of snow mass due to transformation of snow to sea ice divided by sea-ice area
Comments: "Change names of snow-on-sea-ice terms to start with ""sisn"""

Name: mrsos
Title: Moisture in Upper Portion of Soil Column
Description: The mass of water in all phases in the upper 10cm of the  soil layer.

Name: hfsbl
Title: Energy of Sublimation
Description: Energy consumed or released during vapor/solid phase changes.

Name: fGrazing
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Grazing on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to grazing on land

Name: intpppico
Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Picophytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the picophytoplankton component alone

Name: fFireNat
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Natural Fire [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: CO2 emissions from natural fires

Name: swellmpw
Title: Swell Waves Mean Period
Justification for inclusion: Inclusion of wave model's output

Name: phyp
Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton phosphorus components

Name: volcello
Title: Ocean Grid-Cell Volume
Description: grid-cell volume ca. 2000.
Processing Comment: If constant, report as a fixed configuration field, otherwise report as time varying.

Name: hfx
Title: Ocean Heat X Transport
Description: Contains all contributions to "x-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes.  Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Name: fBNF
Title: Biological Nitrogen Fixation
Description: The fixation (uptake of nitrogen gas directly from the atmosphere) of nitrogen due to biological processes.

Name: fFire
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to CO2 Emission from Fire Excluding Land-Use Change [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: CO2 emissions (expressed as a carbon mass flux per unit area) from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).
Comments: Duplicate physical parameter variables (fFire and fFireNat) in CMIP6 data request - Remove the fFire

Name: laiVgt
Title: Leaf Area Index on Vegetation type
Justification for inclusion: This variable allows to assess plant phenology simulated by models and the relative impact for future projections at the vegetation type level.

Name: nppOther
Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Other Pools (not Leaves Stem or Roots) as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: added for completeness with npp\_root

Name: sidmassth
Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change from Thermodynamics
Description: Total change in sea-ice mass from thermodynamic processes divided by grid-cell area

Name: siforceintstrx
Title: Internal Stress Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by internal stress (divergence of sigma)

Name: tasminCrop
Title: Daily Minimum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Description: minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: min")

Name: rsdsdiff
Title: Surface Diffuse Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling solar irradiance from diffuse radiation for UV calculations.

Name: dyto
Title: Northward gridbox width on t points
Proposer name: Jenny Mecking – Ocean and Sea Ice Author Team – National Oceanography Centre – Climate and Uncertainty group
Justification for inclusion: To be able to do accurate calculations for the ocean model the width of the gridboxes in both the east/west and north/south direction is essential. This is particularly true if ocean transects are being investigated. Furthermore, attempting to estimate these parameters using the longitudes and latitudes from the t,u and v grid points often leads to incorrect values due to some models artificially narrowing channels (e.g. Strait of Gibraltar and between various islands in the Indonesian Through flow region.

Name: siv
Title: Y-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
Description: The y-velocity of ice on native model grid

Name: zmlwaero
Title: Zonal Mean Longwave Heating Rate Due to Volcanic Aerosols
Description: longwave heating rate due to volcanic aerosols to be diagnosed through double radiation call, zonal average values required

Name: hfgeoubed
Title: Geothermal Heat Flux Beneath Land Ice
Description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area into the base of grounded land ice. This is related to the geothermal heat flux out of the bedrock, but may be modified by horizontal transport due to run-off and by melting at the interface.
Processing Comment: If this field is time-independent then save it as a fixed field, otherwise save a time dependent version.

Name: hfds
Title: Downward Heat Flux at Sea Water Surface
Description: This is the net flux of heat entering the liquid water column through its upper surface (excluding any "flux adjustment") .

Name: prsnsn
Title: Fraction of Snowfall (Including Hail and Graupel) on Snow
Description: The fraction of the snowfall which falls on the snow pack

Name: emibc
Title: Total Emission Rate of Black Carbon Aerosol Mass
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: pastureFracC4
Title: C4 Pasture Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 pasture

Name: nudgincswe
Title: Nudging Increment of Water in Snow
Description: A nudging increment refers to an amount added to parts of a model system. The phrase "nudging\_increment\_in\_X" refers to an increment in quantity X over a time period which should be defined in the bounds of the time coordinate. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Amount" means mass per unit area. "Snow and ice on land" means ice in glaciers, ice caps, ice sheets & shelves, river and lake ice, any other ice on a land surface, such as frozen flood water, and snow lying on such ice or on the land surface.

Name: pop
Title: Mole Concentration of Particulate Organic Matter Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of particulate organic phosphorus component concentrations

Name: prrc
Title: Convective Rainfall Rate
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: reffclis
Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Cloud Ice
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Name: ccn
Title: Cloud Condensation Nuclei Concentration at Liquid Cloud Top
Description: proposed name: number\_concentration\_of\_ambient\_aerosol\_in\_air\_at\_liquid\_water\_cloud\_top

Name: opottempdiff
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Dianeutral Mixing
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized dianeutral mixing. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Name: tgs
Title: Temperature of Bare Soil
Description: Surface bare soil temperature

Name: mrsll
Title: Liquid Water Content of Soil Layer
Description: in each soil layer, the mass of water in liquid phase.  Reported as "missing" for grid cells occupied entirely by "sea"

Name: dryss
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Description: Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

Name: sfo3
Title: O3 Volume Mixing Ratio in Lowest Model Layer
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: intvaw
Title: Vertically Integrated Northward Moisture Transport
Description: Vertically integrated Northward moisture transport (Mass\_weighted\_vertical integral of the product of northward wind by total water mass per unit mass)

Name: phymiscos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Miscellaneous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from additional phytoplankton component alone

Name: hfmlt
Title: Energy of Fusion
Description: Energy consumed or released during liquid/solid phase changes.

Name: va100m
Title: Northward Wind at 100m
Description: Meridional wind at 100m above the surface.

Name: od550lt1aer
Title: Ambient Fine Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm
Description: od550 due to particles with wet diameter less than 1 um  (ambient here means wetted). When models do not include explicit size information, it can be assumed that all anthropogenic aerosols and natural secondary aerosols have diameter less than 1 um.

Name: dmc
Title: Deep Convective Mass Flux
Description: The net mass flux  represents the difference between the updraft and downdraft components.   This is calculated as the convective mass flux divided by the area of the whole grid cell (not just the area of the cloud).

Name: gpp
Title: Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Gross Primary Production on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: The rate of synthesis of biomass from inorganic precursors by autotrophs ("producers") expressed as the mass of carbon which it contains. For example, photosynthesis in plants or phytoplankton. The producers also respire some of this biomass and the difference is referred to as the net primary production.

Name: osalttend
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from all processes.

Name: difvtrto
Title: Ocean Vertical Tracer Diffusivity Due to Tides
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to tracers due to tides (i.e. caused by astronomical gravity changes which manifest as tides).

Name: tasmaxCrop
Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Air Temperature over Crop Tile
Description: maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature (add cell\_method attribute "time: max")

Name: mfo
Title: Sea Water Transport
Description: Transport across\_line means that which crosses a particular line on the Earth's surface; formally this means the integral along the line of the normal component of the transport.

Name: tntrscs
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Clear Sky Shortwave Radiative Heating

Name: thkcellto
Title: Gridbox Thickness on t points
Proposer name: Jenny Mecking – Ocean and Sea Ice Author Team – National Oceanography Centre – Climate and Uncertainty group
Justification for inclusion: Having the gridbox thickness be accurate at all time points and gridboxes at all model grid points used in the calculations. This is particularly true if ocean transects are being investigated. Previously this information was only provided on t points and it is important to distinguish between t, u, and v points.

Name: siitdsnconc
Title: Snow Area Percentages in Ice Thickness Categories
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by snow in each ice-thickness category (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of the categories as third coordinate axis)

Name: ch3oh
Title: Methanol volume mixing ratio
Justification for inclusion: To understand VOC budgets

Name: msftyrho
Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Comment: For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid this should be omitted.

Name: cLitterGrass
Title: Carbon Mass in Litter on Grass Tiles
Description: "Litter" is dead plant material in or above the soil. It is distinct from coarse wood debris. The precise distinction between "fine" and "coarse" is model dependent. "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The sum of the quantities with standard names surface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon and subsurface\_litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon has the standard name litter\_mass\_content\_of\_carbon.

Name: rlutcs
Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling clear-sky longwave radiation at top of atmosphere

Name: cfc12global
Title: Global Mean Mole Fraction of CFC12
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of CFC12 is CF2Cl2.  The IUPAC name for CFC12 is dichloro-difluoro-methane.

Name: hfy
Title: Ocean Heat Y Transport
Description: Contains all contributions to "y-ward" heat transport from resolved and parameterized processes. Use Celsius for temperature scale.

Name: ho2
Title: HO2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydroperoxyl radical is HO2.

Name: sblnosn
Title: Sublimation of the Snow Free Area
Description: Rate of sublimation of ice into the atmosphere from areas with no snow.

Name: climodis
Title: MODIS Ice Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Total ice cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS).

Name: iareagr
Title: Area Covered by Grounded Ice Sheet
Description: Total area of the grounded ice sheets (the component of ice sheet resting over bedrock)

Name: tnta
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Advection
Description: Tendency of Air Temperature due to Advection

Name: zmicro
Title: Mole Concentration of Microzooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon  concentration from the microzooplankton (<20 um) component alone

Name: phycalc
Title: Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

Name: snc
Title: Snow Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

Name: rainmxrat
Title: Mass Fraction of Rain in Air
Description: Rain mixing ratio

Name: tntmp
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Model Physics
Description: Tendency of air temperature due to model physics. This includes sources and sinks from parametrized physics (e.g. radiation, convection, boundary layer, stratiform condensation/evaporation, etc.). It excludes sources and sinks from resolved dynamics and numerical diffusion not associated with parametrized physics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be included, while numerical diffusion applied in addition to physics or resolved dynamics should be excluded.  This term is required to check the closure of the heat budget.

Name: ua
Title: Eastward Wind
Description: Zonal wind (positive in a eastward direction).

Name: eow
Title: Open Water Evaporation
Description: Evaporation (conversion of liquid or solid into vapor) from open water.

Name: mmrss
Title: Sea-Salt Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of sea salt aerosol (dry mass).

Name: chepno3
Title: Net chemical production of nitrate aerosol
Justification for inclusion: To calculate nitrate aerosol budget

Name: tntpbl
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Boundary Layer Mixing
Description: Includes all boundary layer terms including diffusive terms.

Name: zvelsurf
Title: Upward Component of Land-Ice Surface Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere

Name: nh4os
Title: Surface Dissolved Ammonium Concentration
Description: Mole concentration means moles (amount of substance) per unit volume and is used in the construction mole\_concentration\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: rldsIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Downwelling Longwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Downwelling radiation is radiation from above. It does not mean "net downward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: snmIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Snow Melt
Description: The total surface snow melt rate on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as zero for snow-free land regions and missing where there is no land.

Name: opottemppmdiff
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Potential Temperature Expressed as Heat Content Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Diffusion
Description: Tendency of heat content for a grid cell from parameterized mesoscale eddy diffusion. Reported only for models that use potential temperature as prognostic field.

Name: cVegShrub
Title: Carbon Mass in Vegetation on Shrub Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. "Vegetation" means any plants e.g. trees, shrubs, grass. Plants are autotrophs i.e. "producers" of biomass using carbon obtained from carbon dioxide.

Name: phycmisc
Title: carbon concentration of miscellaneous phytoplankton
Justification for inclusion: Requested by Fish-MIP as part of ISIMIP. Needed for model intercomparisons for marine biodiversity and ecosystems.

Name: reffcclwtop
Title: Cloud-Top Effective Droplet Radius in Convective Cloud
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  This is the effective radius "as seen from space" over convective liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, or for some models it is the sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Reported values are weighted by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.daily data, separated to large-scale clouds, convective clouds. If any of the cloud is from more than one process (i.e. shallow convection), please provide them separately.

Name: rsucsbnd
Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation at Each Level for Each Band
Description: Calculated with aerosols but without clouds. This is a standard clear-sky calculation

Name: albo
Title: Surface Albedo of Ocean without Ice
Justification for inclusion: necessary to understand the response of the cryosphere in various climates

Name: cropFracC3
Title: Percentage Cover by C3 Crops
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C3 crops

Name: cl
Title: Percentage Cloud Cover
Description: Percentage cloud cover, including both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: emibbnox
Title: total emission rate of NOx from all biomass burning
Justification for inclusion: To understand sources of nitrogen

Name: yvelmean
Title: Y-Component of Land Ice Vertical Mean Velocity
Description: The vertical mean land ice velocity is the average from the bedrock to the surface of the ice

Name: hfcorr
Title: Heat Flux Correction
Description: Flux correction is also called "flux adjustment". A positive flux correction is downward i.e. added to the ocean. In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: rsd
Title: Downwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Downwelling shortwave radiation (includes the fluxes at the surface and top-of-atmosphere)

Name: talk
Title: Total Alkalinity
Description: total alkalinity equivalent concentration (including carbonate, nitrogen, silicate, and borate components)

Name: utendwtem
Title: Tendency of Eastward Wind Due to TEM Upward Advection
Description: Tendency of zonally averaged eastward wind, by the residual upward wind advection (on the native model grid). Reference: Andrews et al (1987): Middle Atmospheric Dynamics. Academic Press.
Comments: incorrect units

Name: clisccp
Title: ISCCP Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in optical depth categories.

Name: icemIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt water on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Name: snicemIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of snow and ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Name: sitemptop
Title: Surface Temperature of Sea Ice
Description: Report surface temperature of snow where snow covers the sea ice.

Name: rsusIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "shortwave" means shortwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: od550dust
Title: Dust Optical Thickness at 550nm
Description: Total aerosol AOD due to dust aerosol at a wavelength of 550 nanometres.

Name: fddtdisi
Title: Rate of Change of Net Dissolved Inorganic Silicon
Description: vertical integral of net time rate of change of dissolved inorganic silicate

Name: rsutaf
Title: TOA Outgoing Aerosol-Free Shortwave Radiation
Description: Flux corresponding to rsut resulting from aerosol-free call to radiation, following Ghan (ACP, 2013)

Name: cSoilShrub
Title: Carbon Mass in Soil on Shrub Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content\_of\_soil\_layer are used.

Name: tendlicalvf
Title: Total Calving Flux
Description: The total calving flux over land ice is a spatial integration of the calving flux

Name: limnpico
Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Picophytoplankton
Description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: oh
Title: OH Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: dissocos
Title: Surface Dissolved Organic Carbon Concentration
Description: Sum of dissolved carbon component concentrations explicitly represented (i.e. not ~40 uM refractory unless explicit)

Name: sisndmasssubl
Title: Snow Mass Rate of Change Through Evaporation or Sublimation
Description: the rate of change of snow mass through sublimation and evaporation divided by sea-ice area
Comments: "Change names of snow-on-sea-ice terms to start with ""sisn"""

Name: emiso4
Title: Total Direct Emission Rate of SO4
Description: Direct primary emission does not include secondary sulfate production. Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: wilt
Title: Wilting Point
Description: Percentage water content of soil by volume at the wilting point. The wilting point of soil is the water content below which plants cannot extract sufficient water to balance their loss through transpiration.

Name: chlpico
Title: Mass Concentration of Picophytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: chlorophyll concentration from the picophytoplankton (<2 um) component alone

Name: mmrsoa
Title: Secondary Organic Aerosol Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Mass fraction in the atmosphere of secondary organic aerosols (particulate organic matter formed within the atmosphere from gaseous precursors; dry mass).

Name: sfcWindmax
Title: Daily Maximum Near-Surface Wind Speed
Description: Daily maximum near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.

Name: c14Soil
Title: Mass of 14C in Soil Pool
Description: Carbon-14 mass content per unit area in soil.

Name: rv850
Title: Relative Vorticity at 850hPa
Description: Relative vorticity is the upward component of the vorticity vector i.e. the component which arises from horizontal velocity.

Name: msftmrho
Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.

Name: mrroLi
Title: Land Ice Runoff Flux
Description: Runoff flux over land ice is the difference between any available liquid water in the snowpack less any refreezing. Computed as the sum of rainfall and melt of snow or ice less any refreezing or water retained in the snowpack

Name: hcl
Title: HCl Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.  The chemical formula of hydrogen chloride is HCl.

Name: sconcss
Title: Surface Concentration of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Description: mass concentration of sea-salt dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

Name: spco2
Title: Surface Aqueous Partial Pressure of CO2
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. The partial pressure of a dissolved gas in sea water is the partial pressure in air with which it would be in equilibrium. The partial pressure of a gaseous constituent of air is the pressure which it alone would exert with unchanged temperature and number of moles per unit volume. The chemical formula for carbon dioxide is CO2.

Name: prraIs
Title: Ice Sheet Rainfall Rate
Description: Rainfall rate over the ice sheet

Name: msftyz
Title: Ocean Y Overturning Mass Streamfunction
Description: Overturning mass streamfunction arising from all advective mass transport processes, resolved and parameterized.
Processing Comment: For a model with a cartesian latxlon grid this should be omitted.

Name: cSoilFast
Title: Carbon Mass in Fast Soil Pool
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in fast soil pool. Fast means a lifetime of less than 10 years for reference climate conditions (20th century) in the absence of water limitations.

Name: snicefreez
Title: Surface Snow and Ice Refreeze Flux
Description: Mass flux of surface meltwater which refreezes within the snowpack. Computed as the total refreezing on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Name: mrlqso
Title: Average Layer Fraction of Liquid Moisture
Description: Fraction of soil moisture mass in the liquid phase in each user-defined soil layer (3D variable)

Name: rsucs4co2
Title: Upwelling Clear-Sky Shortwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Upwelling clear-sky shortwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Name: intppnitrate
Title: Primary Organic Carbon Production by Phytoplankton Based on Nitrate Uptake Alone
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton based on nitrate uptake alone

Name: phydiatos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Diatoms Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from the diatom phytoplankton component concentration alone

Name: rlutcs4co2
Title: TOA Outgoing Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation 4XCO2 Atmosphere
Description: Top-of-atmosphere outgoing clear-sky longwave radiation calculated using carbon dioxide concentrations increased fourfold

Name: rsuto3ref
Title: Top of atmosphere shortwave flux from diagnostic call to radiation scheme using a reference ozone field
Justification for inclusion: When combined with output from the prognostic call to the radiation scheme, it can be used to diagnose instantaneous radiative forcing from ozone

Name: tntd
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Numerical Diffusion
Description: This includes any horizontal or vertical numerical temperature diffusion not associated with the parametrized moist physics or the resolved dynamics.  For example, any vertical diffusion which is part of the boundary layer mixing scheme should be excluded, as should any diffusion which is included in the terms from the resolved dynamics.   This term is required to check the closure of the temperature budget.

Name: prveg
Title: Precipitation onto Canopy
Description: The precipitation flux that is intercepted by the vegetation canopy (if present in model) before reaching the ground.

Name: turbidity
Title: turbidity of coastal runoff
Justification for inclusion: turbidity of seawater and coastal runoff

Name: fgo2
Title: Surface Downward Flux of O2
Description: Gas exchange flux of O2 (positive into ocean)

Name: sisnmassacrossline
Title: Snow Mass Flux Through Straits
Description: net (sum of transport in all directions) sea ice area transport through the following four passages, positive into the Arctic Ocean 1. Fram Strait = (11.5W,81.3N to (10.5E,79.6N) 2. Canadian Archipelago = (128.2W,70.6N) to (59.3W,82.1N) 3. Barents opening = (16.8E,76.5N) to (19.2E,70.2N) 4. Bering Strait = (171W,66.2N) to (166W,65N)
Comments: "Change names of snow-on-sea-ice terms to start with ""sisn"""

Name: cfadLidarsr532
Title: CALIPSO Scattering Ratio CFAD
Description: CFAD (Cloud Frequency Altitude Diagrams) are frequency distributions of radar  reflectivity (or lidar scattering ratio) as a function of altitude. The variable cfadLidarsr532 is defined as the simulated relative frequency of lidar scattering ratio in sampling volumes defined by altitude bins. The lidar is observing at a wavelength of 532nm.

Name: epc1000
Title: Downward Flux of Particulate Organic Carbon at 1000m
Justification for inclusion: Changes in particulate organic matter as carbon (POC) impact storage of carbon in the ocean via biology (Csoft). Changes in the flux of particulate organic matter (as carbon) at 1000m is a much more accurate predictor of changes in carbon storage than the traditionally used flux at 100m (epc100) - Wilson et al., (2022) PNAS (<https://doi.org/10.1073/pnas.2204369119>)

Name: necbLut
Title: Net Carbon Mass Flux into Land-Use Tile [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Computed as npp minus heterotrophic respiration minus fire minus C leaching minus harvesting/clearing. Positive rate is into the land, negative rate is from the land.  Do not include fluxes from anthropogenic product pools to atmosphere

Name: cls
Title: Percentage Cover of Stratiform Cloud
Description: Cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column due to stratiform clouds, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: fLulccResidueLut
Title: Carbon Transferred to Soil or Litter Pools Due to Land-Use or Land-Cover Change Processes on Tile
Description: This annual mean flux refers to the transfer of carbon into soil or litter pools due to any land use or land-cover change activities

Name: msftmzmpa
Title: Ocean Meridional Overturning Mass Streamfunction Due to Parameterized Mesoscale Advection
Description: CMIP5 called this "due to Bolus Advection".  Name change respects the more general physics of the mesoscale parameterizations.

Name: rls
Title: Net Longwave Surface Radiation
Description: Net longwave surface radiation

Name: diftrebo
Title: Ocean Tracer Epineutral Biharmonic Diffusivity
Description: Epineutral diffusivity means a lateral diffusivity along a either a neutral or isopycnal density surface due to motion which is not resolved on the grid scale of an ocean model. The type of density surface is dependent on the model formulation.

Name: co3sataragos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Carbonate Ion in Equilibrium with Pure Aragonite in Sea Water
Description: Near surface mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3) for sea water in equilibrium with pure Aragonite. Aragonite  (CaCO3) is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate.

Name: hfssIs
Title: Ice Sheet Surface Upward Sensible Heat Flux
Description: Upward sensible heat flux from the ice sheet surface. The surface sensible heat flux, also called turbulent heat flux, is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air by motion of air.

Name: ppos
Title: Primary Carbon Production by Phytoplankton
Description: total primary (organic carbon) production by phytoplankton

Name: siforcetiltx
Title: Sea-Surface Tilt Term in Force Balance (X-Component)
Description: X-component of force on sea ice caused by sea-surface tilt

Name: clcalipsoice
Title: CALIPSO Ice Cloud Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in CALIPSO standard atmospheric layers.

Name: intppcalc
Title: Net Primary Mole Productivity of Carbon by Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the calcareous phytoplankton component alone

Name: depdust
Title: Total Deposition Rate of Dust
Description: Fdry mass deposition rate of dust

Name: vsf
Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water
Description: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

Name: snrefr
Title: Refreezing of Water in the Snow
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics. The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Surface snow and ice refreezing flux" means the mass flux of surface  meltwater which refreezes within the snow or firn.

Name: rlusLut
Title: Surface Upwelling Longwave on Land-Use Tile
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "longwave" means longwave radiation. Upwelling radiation is radiation from below. It does not mean "net upward". When thought of as being incident on a surface, a radiative flux is sometimes called "irradiance". In addition, it is identical with the quantity measured by a cosine-collector light-meter and sometimes called "vector irradiance". In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: siitdthick
Title: Sea-Ice Thickness in Thickness Categories
Description: Actual (floe) thickness of sea ice in each  category (NOT volume divided by grid area),  (vector with one entry for each thickness category starting from the thinnest category, netcdf file should use thickness bounds of categories as third coordinate axis)

Name: snm
Title: Surface Snow Melt
Description: The total surface snow melt rate on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report as zero for snow-free land regions and missing where there is no land.

Name: physi
Title: Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Silicon in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton silica component concentrations

Name: netAtmosLandC13Flux
Title: Net Mass Flux of 13C Between Atmosphere and Land (Positive into Land) as a Result of All Processes [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of carbon 31as carbon dioxide into the land. This flux should be reproducible by differencing the sum of all carbon pools (cVeg, cLitter, cSoil, and cProducts or equivalently cLand) from one time step to the next, except in the case of lateral transfer of carbon due to harvest, riverine transport of dissolved organic and/or inorganic carbon, or any other process (in which case the lateral\_carbon\_transfer\_over\_land term, see below, will be zero data).-

Name: nMineral
Title: Mineral Nitrogen in the Soil
Description: SUM of ammonium, nitrite, nitrate, etc over all soil layers

Name: clivic
Title: Convective Ice Water Path
Description: calculate mass of convective ice water in the column divided by the area of the column (not just the area of the cloudy portion of the column). This includes precipitating frozen hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: fHarvest
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Crop Harvesting [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Carbon mass flux per unit area due to crop harvesting

Name: icem
Title: Surface Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt water on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Name: cSoilTree
Title: Carbon Mass in Soil on Tree Tiles
Description: "Content" indicates a quantity per unit area. The "soil content" of a quantity refers to the vertical integral from the surface down to the bottom of the soil model. For the content between specified levels in the soil, standard names including content\_of\_soil\_layer are used.

Name: tnhus
Title: Tendency of Specific Humidity
Description: Tendency of Specific Humidity

Name: sncIs
Title: Ice Sheet Snow Cover Percentage
Description: Percentage of each grid cell that is occupied by snow that rests on land portion of cell.

Name: thkcello
Title: Ocean Model Cell Thickness
Description: "Thickness" means the vertical extent of a layer. "Cell" refers to a model grid-cell.
Processing Comment: If constant, report as a fixed configuration field, otherwise report as time varying.
Comments: Clearly labelling where there are choices between variables.

Name: phypos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Phosphorus in Sea Water
Description: sum of phytoplankton phosphorus components

Name: vsfcorr
Title: Virtual Salt Flux Correction
Description: It is set to zero in models which receive a real water flux.

Name: pr2h
Title: Precipitation Flux of Water Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid and liquid phases.

Name: ugrido
Title: UGRID Grid Specification
Description: Ony required for models with unstructured grids: this label should be used for a file containing information about the grid structure, following the UGRID convention.

Name: siflsaltbot
Title: Salt Flux from Sea Ice
Justification for inclusion: siflsaltbot represents the total flux of salt from water into sea ice divided by grid-cell area; salt flux is upward (negative) during ice growth when salt is embedded into the ice and downward (positive) during melt when salt from sea ice is again released to the ocean. This term is needed to close the freshwater balance when there is a prognostic sea ice salinity and actual simulated brine (and hence salt) rejection from sea ice.

Name: rlutcsch4ref
Title: Top of atmosphere outgoing longwave radiative fluxes under clear sky conditions from diagnostic radiation call with reference methane
Justification for inclusion: To calculate instantaneous radiative forcing by methane
Atmosphere review comments copy: CF name marked for acceptance (26th Sept)

Name: so2
Title: SO2 Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Mole fraction is used in the construction mole\_fraction\_of\_X\_in\_Y, where X is a material constituent of Y.

Name: nppShrub
Title: Net Primary Production on Shrub Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total NPP of shrubs in the grid cell

Name: evspsblsoi
Title: Water Evaporation from Soil
Description: Water evaporation from soil (including sublimation).

Name: froc
Title: Downward Organic Carbon Flux at Ocean Bottom
Description: Organic Carbon loss to sediments

Name: loadso4
Title: Load of SO4
Description: The total dry mass of sulfate aerosol particles per unit area.

Name: phycalcos
Title: Surface Mole Concentration of Calcareous Phytoplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon concentration from calcareous (calcite-producing) phytoplankton component alone

Name: emiisop
Title: Total Emission Rate of Isoprene
Description: Integrate 3D emission field vertically to 2d field

Name: xvelbase
Title: X-Component of Land Ice Basal Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "x" indicates a vector component along the grid x-axis, positive with increasing x. "Land ice" means glaciers, ice-caps and ice-sheets resting on bedrock and also includes ice-shelves. "basal" means the lower boundary of the land ice.

Name: dryso4
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of SO4
Description: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition

Name: siflcondtop
Title: Net Conductive Heat Flux in Ice at the Surface
Description: the net heat conduction flux at the ice surface

Name: sconcdust
Title: Surface Concentration of Dust
Description: mass concentration of dust dry aerosol in air in model lowest layer

Name: dtaus
Title: Stratiform Cloud Optical Depth
Description: This is the in-cloud optical depth obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell.

Name: emiach4
Title: Anthropogenic emission rate of CH4
Justification for inclusion: To calculate methane budgets in new methane emissions-driven modelling capability

Name: zg1000
Title: Geopotential Height at 1000hPa
Description: Geopotential height on the 1000 hPa surface

Name: fProductDecompLut
Title: Net Carbon Mass Flux from Wood and Agricultural Product Pools on Land Use Tile into Atmosphere [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites. Produce this variable i  a model has explicit anthropogenic product pools by land use tile

Name: licalvf
Title: Land Ice Calving Flux
Description: Loss of ice mass resulting from iceberg calving. Computed as the rate of mass loss by the ice shelf (in kg s-1) divided by the horizontal area of the ice sheet (m2) in the grid box.

Name: treeFrac
Title: Tree Cover Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by trees.

Name: soga
Title: Global Mean Sea Water Salinity
Description: Sea water salinity is the salt content of sea water, often on the Practical Salinity Scale of 1978. However, the unqualified term 'salinity' is generic and does not necessarily imply any particular method of calculation. The units of salinity are dimensionless and the units attribute should normally be given as 1e-3 or 0.001 i.e. parts per thousand.

Name: albsn
Title: Snow Albedo
Description: Albedo of the snow-covered surface, averaged over the grid cell.

Name: difvho
Title: Ocean Vertical Heat Diffusivity
Description: Vertical/dianeutral diffusivity applied to prognostic temperature field.

Name: phabio
Title: Abiotic pH
Description: negative log10 of hydrogen ion concentration with the concentration expressed as mol H kg-1 (abiotic component)..

Name: rootdsl
Title: Root Distribution
Description: Mass of carbon in roots.

Name: tauunogw
Title: Westward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization
Justification for inclusion: Gravity wave momentum fluxes are the key quantity within the gravity wave parameterization schemes. Their divergence results to the drag on the background flow. Also, they are much easier comparable to observations than the drags themselves.
Proposed CF Standard Name: Westward Reynolds stress from non-orographic gravity wave parameterization

Name: nLand
Title: Total Nitrogen in All Terrestrial Nitrogen Pools
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: taUTLS
Title: '6 hourly instantaneous air temperature at 3 pressure levels in the UTLS region (150, 200, and 250 hPa) '
Justification for inclusion: Variable requested for aviation impacts. Needed to diagnose clear air turbulence.

Name: noy
Title: Total Reactive Nitrogen Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Total family (the sum of all appropriate species in the model); list the species in the netCDF header, e.g. NOy = N + NO + NO2 + NO3 + HNO3 + 2N2O5 + HNO4 + ClONO2 + BrONO2 Definition: Total reactive nitrogen; usually includes atomic nitrogen (N), nitric oxide (NO), NO2, nitrogen trioxide (NO3), dinitrogen radical (N2O5), nitric acid (HNO3), peroxynitric acid (HNO4), BrONO2, ClONO2 add comment attribute with detailed description about how the model calculates these fields

Name: zhalfo
Title: Depth Below Geoid of Interfaces Between Ocean Layers
Description: Depth below geoid

Name: expsi
Title: Sinking Particulate Silicon Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Name: vmrox
Title: Mole Fraction of Odd Oxygen (O, O3 and O1D)
Description: Mole Fraction of Ox

Name: od550bb
Title: Aerosol Optical Depth at 550nm Due to Biomass Burning
Description: total organic aerosol AOD due to biomass burning (excluding so4, nitrate BB components)

Name: photo1d
Title: Photolysis Rate of Ozone (O3) to Excited Atomic Oxygen (the Singlet D State, O1D)
Description: proposed name: photolysis\_rate\_of\_ozone\_to\_O1D

Name: orog
Title: Surface Altitude
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. Altitude is the (geometric) height above the geoid, which is the reference geopotential surface. The geoid is similar to mean sea level.

Name: sisnmass
Title: Snow Mass per Area
Description: Total mass of snow on sea ice divided by sea-ice area.
Comments: Changing parameter's CF standard name to surface_snow_amount

Name: rlntds
Title: Surface Net Downward Longwave Radiation
Description: This is defined as "where ice\_free\_sea over sea"

Name: opottempmint
Title: Integral with Respect to Depth of Product of Sea Water Density and Potential Temperature
Description: Integral over the full ocean depth of the product of sea water density and potential temperature.

Name: dryo3
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of O3
Description: Dry Deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

Name: psl
Title: Sea Level Pressure
Description: Sea Level Pressure

Name: fgdms
Title: Surface Upward Flux of DMS
Description: Gas exchange flux of DMS (positive into atmosphere)

Name: rsutch4ref
Title: Top of atmosphere shortwave outgoing radiation from a diagnostic call with a reference methane field
Justification for inclusion: For use in calculating instantaneous radiative forcing by methane
Atmosphere review comments copy: CF name marked for acceptance (26th Sept)

Name: hflso
Title: Surface Downward Latent Heat Flux
Description: This is defined as with the cell methods string: where ice\_free\_sea over sea

Name: dmlt
Title: Depth to Soil Thaw
Description: Depth from surface to the zero degree isotherm. Above this isotherm T > 0o, and below this line T < 0o. Missing if surface is frozen or if soil is unfrozen at all depths.

Name: drynoy
Title: Dry Deposition Rate of NOy
Description: NOy is the sum of all simulated oxidized nitrogen species out of NO, NO2, HNO3, HNO4, NO3 aerosol, NO3(radical), N2O5, PAN, other organic nitrates. Dry deposition includes gravitational settling and turbulent deposition.

Name: clhcalipso
Title: CALIPSO High Level Cloud Area Percentage
Description: Percentage cloud cover in layer centred on 220hPa

Name: cVeg
Title: Carbon Mass in Vegetation
Description: Carbon mass per unit area in vegetation.

Name: nppLeaf
Title: Net Primary Production Allocated to Leaves as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: This is the rate of carbon uptake by leaves due to NPP

Name: mrso
Title: Total Soil Moisture Content
Description: the mass per unit area  (summed over all soil layers) of water in all phases.

Name: rldscs
Title: Surface Downwelling Clear-Sky Longwave Radiation
Description: Surface downwelling clear-sky longwave radiation

Name: reffsnows
Title: Hydrometeor Effective Radius of Stratiform Snowfall
Description: This is defined as the in-cloud ratio of the third moment over the second moment of the particle size distribution (obtained by considering only the cloudy portion of the grid cell).

Name: expn
Title: Sinking Particulate Organic Nitrogen Flux
Description: In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.   'Sinking' is the gravitational settling of particulate matter suspended in a liquid. A sinking flux is positive downwards and is calculated relative to the movement of the surrounding fluid.

Name: cldncl
Title: Cloud Droplet Number Concentration of Cloud Tops
Description: Droplets are liquid only.  Report concentration 'as seen from space' over liquid cloudy portion of grid cell.  This is the value from uppermost model layer with liquid cloud or, if available, it is better to sum over all liquid cloud tops, no matter where they occur, as long as they are seen from the top of the atmosphere. Weight by total liquid cloud top fraction of  (as seen from TOA) each time sample when computing monthly mean.

Name: hfls
Title: Surface Upward Latent Heat Flux
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward). The surface latent heat flux is the exchange of heat between the surface and the air on account of evaporation (including sublimation). In accordance with common usage in geophysical disciplines, "flux" implies per unit area, called "flux density" in physics.

Name: chldiaz
Title: Mass Concentration of Diazotrophs Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: Chlorophyll concentration from the diazotrophic phytoplankton component alone

Name: snmsl
Title: Water Flowing out of Snowpack
Description: Mass flow rate of water draining out of the snow pack.

Name: fNloss
Title: Total Nitrogen Lost (Including NHx, NOx, N2O, N2 and Leaching)
Description: Not all models split losses into gaseous and leaching

Name: prsn2h
Title: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Deuterium (1H 2H O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain one atom of the hydrogen-2 isotope (1H 2H O), including solid phase only.

Name: pso
Title: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Water Surface
Description: The surface called "surface" means the lower boundary of the atmosphere.  "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

Name: zmisc
Title: Mole Concentration of Other Zooplankton Expressed as Carbon in Sea Water
Description: carbon from additional zooplankton component concentrations alone (e.g. Micro, meso).  Since the models all have different numbers of components, this variable has been included to provide a check for intercomparison between models since some phytoplankton groups are supersets.

Name: tntc
Title: Tendency of Air Temperature Due to Convection
Description: Tendencies from cumulus convection scheme.

Name: prsn17O
Title: Precipitation Flux of Snow and Ice Containing Oxygen-17 (H2 17O)
Description: Precipitation mass flux of water molecules that contain the oxygen-17 isotope (H2 17O), including solid phase only.

Name: siu
Title: X-Component of Sea-Ice Velocity
Description: The x-velocity of ice on native model grid

Name: rivo
Title: River Discharge
Description: Outflow of River Water from Cell

Name: baccos
Title: Surface Bacterial Carbon Concentration
Description: Sum of bacterial carbon component concentrations

Name: nppGrass
Title: Net Primary Production on Grass Tiles as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Total NPP of grass in the grid cell

Name: vsfpr
Title: Virtual Salt Flux into Sea Water Due to Rainfall
Description: zero for models using real water fluxes.

Name: rsut
Title: TOA Outgoing Shortwave Radiation
Description: at the top of the atmosphere

Name: osaltpadvect
Title: Tendency of Sea Water Salinity Expressed as Salt Content Due to Parameterized Eddy Advection
Description: Tendency of salt content for a grid cell from parameterized eddy advection (any form of eddy advection).

Name: emioa
Title: Primary Emission and Chemical Production of Dry Aerosol Organic Matter
Description: This is the sum of total emission of primary organic aerosol (POA) and total production of secondary organic aerosol (SOA) (emipoa+chepsoa). Here, mass refers to the mass of organic matter, not mass of organic carbon alone. We recommend a scale factor of POM=1.4\*OC, unless your model has more detailed info available.  Integrate 3D chemical production and emission field vertically to 2d field.

Name: wo
Title: Sea Water Vertical Velocity
Description: A velocity is a vector quantity. "Upward" indicates a vector component which is positive when directed upward (negative downward).

Name: sftgif
Title: Land Ice Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by land ice (ice sheet, ice shelf, ice cap, glacier)

Name: clws
Title: Mass Fraction of Stratiform Cloud Liquid Water
Description: Calculated as the mass of stratiform cloud liquid water in the grid cell divided by the mass of air (including the water in all phases) in the grid cell.  This includes precipitating hydrometeors ONLY if the precipitating hydrometeors affect the calculation of radiative transfer in model.

Name: noaahi2m
Title: mean 2m daily NOAA heat index
Justification for inclusion: Important for the estimation of heat stress on human health

Name: limfepico
Title: Iron Limitation of Picophytoplankton
Description: Picophytoplankton are phytoplankton of less than 2 micrometers in size. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Iron growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of iron) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on iron availability.

Name: sftflf
Title: Floating Ice Shelf Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of grid cell covered by floating ice shelf, the component of the ice sheet that is flowing over sea water

Name: grassFracC4
Title: C4 Natural Grass Area Percentage
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell covered by C4 natural grass.

Name: dissicabioos
Title: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: limncalc
Title: Nitrogen Limitation of Calcareous Phytoplankton
Description: "Calcareous phytoplankton" are phytoplankton that produce calcite. Calcite is a mineral that is a polymorph of calcium carbonate. The chemical formula of calcite is CaCO3. Phytoplankton are algae that grow where there is sufficient light to support photosynthesis. "Nitrogen growth limitation" means the ratio of the growth rate of a species population in the environment (where there is a finite availability of nitrogen) to the theoretical growth rate if there were no such limit on nitrogen availability.

Name: treeFracPrimEver
Title: Percentage Cover by Primary Evergreen Trees
Description: Percentage of entire grid cell  that is covered by primary evergreen trees.

Name: hfgeou
Title: Upward Geothermal Heat Flux at Sea Floor
Description: Upward geothermal heat flux per unit area on the sea floor
Processing Comment: If this field is time-independent then save it as a fixed field, otherwise save a time dependent version.

Name: arag
Title: Aragonite Concentration
Description: Sum of particulate aragonite components (e.g. Phytoplankton, Detrital, etc.)

Name: bddtdic
Title: Rate of Change of Dissolved Inorganic Carbon Due to Biological Activity
Description: Net total of biological terms in time rate of change of dissolved inorganic carbon

Name: fProductDecomp
Title: Decomposition out of Product Pools to CO2 in Atmosphere as Carbon Mass Flux [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Flux of CO2 from product pools into the atmosphere. Examples of "forestry and agricultural products" are paper, cardboard, furniture, timber for construction, biofuels and food for both humans and livestock. Models that simulate land use changes have one or more pools of carbon that represent these products in order to conserve carbon and allow its eventual release into the atmosphere, for example, when the products decompose in landfill sites.

Name: mrroIs
Title: Ice Sheet Total Runoff
Description: The total run-off (including drainage through the base of the soil model) per unit area leaving the land portion of the grid cell.

Name: intppdiat
Title: Net Primary Organic Carbon Production by Diatoms
Description: Vertically integrated primary (organic carbon) production by the diatom phytoplankton component alone

Name: sivoln
Title: Sea-Ice Volume North
Description: total volume of sea ice in the Northern hemisphere

Name: sidragbot
Title: Ocean Drag Coefficient
Description: Oceanic drag coefficient that is used to calculate the oceanic momentum drag on sea ice

Name: tropch4lossoh
Title: Loss of CH4 due to tropospheric loss by OH
Justification for inclusion: To calculate methane budgets with new methane emissions-driven modelling capability

Name: gppVgt
Title: Gross Primary Production on Vegetation type as Carbon Mass Flux
Justification for inclusion: This physical parameter allows to assess phenology simulated by models and the relative impact for future projections at vegetation type level.

Name: snicem
Title: Surface Snow and Ice Melt Flux
Description: Loss of snow and ice mass resulting from surface melting. Computed as the total surface melt on the land ice portion of the grid cell divided by land ice area in the grid cell.

Name: nep
Title: Net Carbon Mass Flux out of Atmosphere Due to Net Ecosystem Productivity on Land [kgC m-2 s-1]
Description: Natural flux of CO2 (expressed as a mass flux of carbon) from the atmosphere to the land calculated as the difference between uptake associated will photosynthesis and the release of CO2 from the sum of plant and soil respiration and fire.  Positive flux is into the land.  Emissions from natural fires and human ignition fires as calculated by the fire module of the dynamic vegetation model, but excluding any CO2 flux from fire included in fLuc (CO2 Flux to Atmosphere from Land Use Change).

Name: sihc
Title: Sea-Ice Heat Content per Unit Area
Description: Heat content of all ice in grid cell divided by total grid-cell area. Water at 0 Celsius is assumed to have a heat content of 0 J.  Does not include heat content of snow, but does include heat content of brine. Heat content is always negative, since both the sensible and the latent heat content of ice are less than that of water

Name: nProduct
Title: Nitrogen Mass in Products of Land-Use Change
Description: Report missing data over ocean grid cells. For fractional land report value averaged over the land fraction.

Name: prw18O
Title: Mass of Water Vapor Containing Oxygen-18 (H2 18O) in Layer
Description: Water vapor path for water molecules that contain oxygen-18 (H2 18O)

Name: rhLitter
Title: Carbon Mass Flux into Atmosphere Due to Heterotrophic Respiration from Litter on Land
Description: Needed to calculate litter bulk turnover time. Includes respiration from CWD as well.

Name: cod
Title: Cloud Optical Depth
Description: The optical thickness is the integral along the path of radiation of a volume scattering/absorption/attenuation coefficient. The radiative flux is reduced by a factor exp(-optical\_thickness) on traversing the path. A coordinate variable of radiation\_wavelength or radiation\_frequency can be specified to indicate that the optical thickness applies at specific wavelengths or frequencies. The atmosphere optical thickness applies to radiation passing through the entire atmosphere. "Cloud" means the component of extinction owing to the presence of liquid or ice water particles. The specification of a physical process by the phrase due\_to\_process means that the quantity named is a  single term in a sum of terms which together compose the general quantity named by omitting the phrase.

Name: chl
Title: Mass Concentration of Total Phytoplankton Expressed as Chlorophyll in Sea Water
Description: Sum of chlorophyll from all phytoplankton group concentrations.  In most models this is equal to chldiat+chlmisc, that is the sum of Diatom Chlorophyll Mass Concentration and Other Phytoplankton Chlorophyll Mass Concentration

Name: prcsh
Title: Precipitation Flux from Shallow Convection
Description: Convection precipitation from shallow convection

Name: rsu
Title: Upwelling Shortwave Radiation
Description: Upwelling shortwave radiation  (includes also the fluxes at the surface and top of atmosphere)

Name: sidmassevapsubl
Title: Sea-Ice Mass Change Through Evaporation and Sublimation
Description: The rate of change of sea-ice mass change through evaporation and sublimation divided by grid-cell area

Name: wbptemp
Title: Wet Bulb Potential Temperature
Description: Wet bulb potential temperature

Name: mmrnh4
Title: NH4 Mass Mixing Ratio
Description: Dry mass fraction of ammonium aerosol particles in air.

Name: uqint
Title: Eastward Humidity Transport
Description: Column integrated eastward wind times specific humidity

Name: fVegLitterSenescence
Title: Total Carbon Mass Flux from Vegetation to Litter as a Result of Leaf, Branch, and Root Senescence
Description: needed to separate changing vegetation C turnover times resulting from changing allocation versus changing mortality

Name: dissi14cabioos
Title: Surface Abiotic Dissolved Inorganic Carbon-14 Concentration
Description: Abiotic Dissolved inorganic carbon-14 (CO3+HCO3+H2CO3) concentration

Name: lwsffluxaero
Title: Longwave Flux Due to Volcanic Aerosols at the Surface
Description: downwelling longwave  flux  due to volcanic aerosols at the surface to be diagnosed through double radiation call

Name: lithk
Title: Ice Sheet Thickness
Description: The thickness of the ice sheet

Name: c2h5oh
Title: Ethanol volume mixing ratio
Justification for inclusion: To understand VOC budgets

Name: thetao
Title: Sea Water Potential Temperature
Description: Diagnostic should be contributed even for models using conservative temperature as prognostic field.
Comments: Clearly labelling where there are choices between variables.

Name: cMisc
Title: Carbon Mass in Other Living Compartments on Land
Description: e.g., labile, fruits, reserves, etc.

Name: pbo
Title: Sea Water Pressure at Sea Floor
Description: "Sea water pressure" is the pressure that exists in the medium of sea water.  It includes the pressure due to overlying sea water, sea ice, air and any other medium that may be present.

Name: cltmodis
Title: MODIS Total Cloud Cover Percentage
Description: Total cloud area fraction (reported as a percentage) for the whole atmospheric column, as seen by the  Moderate Resolution Imaging Spectroradiometer (MODIS). Includes both large-scale and convective cloud.

Name: co3
Title: Carbonate Ion Concentration
Description: Mole concentration (number of moles per unit volume: molarity) of the carbonate anion (CO3).

Name: wetss
Title: Wet Deposition Rate of Sea-Salt Aerosol
Description: Deposition rate of sea salt aerosols (measured by the dry mass) due to wet processes

Name: o3ste
Title: Stratospheric Ozone Tracer Volume Mixing Ratio
Description: Ozone tracer intended to map out strat-trop exchange (STE) of ozone. Set to ozone in the stratosphere, then destroyed in the troposphere using the ozone chemical loss rate. Please specify the tropopause definition used

Name: vaUTLS
Title: '6 hourly instantaneous eastward wind at 3 pressure levels in the UTLS region (150, 200, and 250 hPa) '
